loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena M. Adjei has been a seamstress for the past five years and is based in Jukwa, near Abura, Cape Coast. Educated up to junior high school, she is married to a mason and she and her husband have two children. Her earnings are used to pay for household expenses. 
She wishes to expand her business and she will use her loan to purchase additional clothes for sale. Any additional profits she makes will be saved up.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes for sale.

loans.name: Muñequitas Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "MUÑEQUITAS" esta ubicado en EL Estado de MÉxico esta conformado por 11 integrantes entre ellas se encuentra la señora Veronica Sandra G. quien tiene un negocio de tienda de regalos desde hace 5 años que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, inicio con muy poca mercancia y al principio no tenia un lugar establecido para sus ventas poco a poco el negocio dió frutos y logro establer un local. El crédito lo desea para tener mejor variedad de producto y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos, ya que su mayor anhelo es que sus hijas tengan una mejor calidad de vida y los ingresos suficientes para poder hacerle frente a sus necesidades economicas así como apoyar a su esposo con los gastos alimenticios y de educacion de sus hijas, ellas tiene tres hijas de 5 años 8 años y 10 años actualmente cursan preescolar y primaria y desea brindarles una carrera profesaional.
texts.en: The name of the group is "Little Dolls" and it is located in the state of Mexico. It is made up of 11 members and among them is Veronica Sandra G.. She has had a souvenir business for the past 5 years and it is located in her house. She started out with very little merchandise and at the start she didn't have a conditioned space for her sales but gradually the business began to prosper and she managed to set up a store. She requires the loan to have a better variety of products and therefore increase her sales. Her greatest goal is to see her daughters have a better quality of life and to have enough income to meet their financial needs, such as helping her husband with the nutrition and education expenses of their daughters. She has three daughters, aged 5, 8, and 10 years old. They are in preschool, and primary school and she wants to support them to have a professional career.

loans.use: to purchase souvenirs to stock her store

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi B. sells salt in both small and large quantities at the Jukwa Market, a major market near Abura, Cape Coast. She has made her living this way for five years. She was educated up to junior high school level. 

Esi is married to a blacksmith and her earnings help pay for their four children’s school fees as well as household expenses. With the goal of expanding her business, Esi will use the loan to purchase additional bags of salt to supply her customers. She plans to save the new profits earned from her expanded business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of salt to sell.

loans.name: Ama Dorcas

texts.en: Ama Dorcas B. went to a vocational school, where she learnt how to cook which has helped her make a living. She has make and sold doughnuts for the past four years. She plies her trade at the Jukwa Market, a big market near Abura in Cape Coast. She is married to a kente weaver and they have three children. Her family relies on her earnings to pay for school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more flour to produce more doughnuts to boost her sales. She plans to save the extra earnings for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more flour to produce more doughnuts to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yaa Ataa

texts.en: Yaa Ataa P. sells baked bread at the Jukwa Market, a major market near Abura, Cape Coast. She has made her living this way for the past 15 years. Yaa is keen to expand her business and plans to use her loan to purchase more ingredients to bake more bread. She is married to a carpenter and they have three children. Her income helps pay the school fees and utility bills. She hopes to save up the extra earnings from her expanded business for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to bake bread.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba Y. has been selling fried fish at Jukwa near Abura (Cape Coast) for 10 years. Married to a farmer, she and her husband have four children. They rely on her earnings to pay school fees and the household utility bills. She buys her fish from Elmina, which has a major fish market and plans to use her loan to purchase more fish to increase the volume of her sales. She intends to save the extra profits for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi A. has been selling palm oil for three years in Jukwa near Abura, Cape Coast. She is married to a blacksmith and they have one child. Her income helps with their household expenses. Asi will use the loan to expand her business. She plans to purchase more palm fruit to increase her production of palm oil. She hopes that with the additional profits, she’ll be able to save up some money for her family’s future.

loans.use: to make more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia M. sells palm oil, which she extracts directly from the palm fruit. For over 10 years, she has been selling palm oil at the Jukwa Market, a major market situated near Abura, Cape Coast. She is married to a farmer and they have four children. Her earnings help pay for the school fees and household utility bills. To expand her business, she plans to purchase more palm fruit (which you can see in the photograph) to produce larger volumes of palm oil. She hopes this will increase her sales and profits, which she plans to save up for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Divorced with six children, Efua B. has been selling palm oil and food items such as garden eggs (as shown in the photograph) at Jukwa Market near Abura, Cape Coast, for six years now. Being the sole provider for her family, she is keen to expand her business to grow her income. She plans to use the loan to purchase more food items to sell, as demand for them has increased. The extra profits she is aiming to earn will be saved up for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa K. sells palm oil at the Jukwa Market near Abura, Cape Coast.  To supplement her earnings, she also sells food items such as garden eggs (shown in the photograph). Widowed with four children, Adwoa has been making her living in this fashion for a number of years now. 

She is solely responsible for providing for her family. To improve her earnings, she intends to purchase more bags of garden eggs to deliver to her increasing customers so she can increase her sales. She plans to save up the extra earnings for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of garden eggs

loans.name: Ama Cecelia

texts.en:
Ama Cecelia D. is divorced and has three children. For the past 13 years, she has been selling cooking pots, as shown in the photograph. These pots are usually used by food sellers who make banku (a Ghanaian staple made of fermented cassava dough), waakye (rice and beans) and soup. She sells her pots in the Jukwa Market near Abura, Cape Coast. 

As the sole breadwinner for her family, Ama Cecelia wants to improve her income by expanding her business. She plans to purchase more pots to sell. She hopes to save the extra earnings for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more pots to sell

loans.name: Sherifatu

texts.en: Sherifatu S. is a palm oil seller at the Jukwa Market, which is a major market near Abura, Cape Coast. She has been making her living through palm oil for the past three years. She has completed her junior high school education. Her husband is a driver and they have two children. Sherifatu’s earnings help pay for school fees and utility bills. To expand her business, she plans to use the loan to purchase larger quantities of palm fruit to extract more oil to sell. She plans to save the additional profits from the extra sales for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of palm fruit to extract more oil to sell.

loans.name: The Stars Of Tula Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LAS ESTRELLAS DE TULA" debido a que, por el lugar donde esta ubicado, suele apreciarse perfectamente por las noches el cielo despejado y se ven en todo su esplendor. Esta ubicado en Hidalgo, en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Apolonia C. C. es integrante del grupo, tiene 48 años, estudio hasta la primaria, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijas mujeres. Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como actividad principal desde hace 27 años, asi como a la venta de alfalfa y leche como actividad adicional. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en materia prima, principalmente maiz e insumos, para su negocio de antojitos, asi como para alimento y vitamina en su ganado, para la venta de leche. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente contenta, ya que en base al credito, comenzara a concluir sus planes, por el momento unicamente sus vecinos son sus principales compradores, y se sienten a gusto con ella por su calidad tanto en el producto como en el servicio que ofrece. La señora Apolonia desea poder ofrecerles a sus hijas una carrera profesional para que tengan una mejor vida.
texts.en:
The name of the group is "The Stars of Tula" given that the location is perfect for stargazing on a clear night and they can be seen in their entire splendor. It is located in Hidalgo, Mexico. The group is made up of 9 members. Mrs. Apolonia C. C. is a member of the group. She is 48 years old and she has a primary school education. She is a merchant and she has two daughters. She has been selling Mexican snacks as her primary business for the past 27 years. She sells alfalfa and milk as an additional business. 

She requests a loan to invest in ingredients, primarily corn and other ingredients for her snack business. She will also purchase feed and vitamins for her dairy cattle business. When she requested the loan she felt happy and she knows that with the help of this loan she will be able to reach her goals. For the time being her neighbors are her primary customers and they are happy with her for the quality of the products and for the customer service she provides. Apolonia wishes to support her daughters to achieve a professional career in order to have a better life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of feed and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua H. sells rice and beans at Jukwa near Abura, Cape Coast. She’s been in this trade for five years now. She is married to a driver and they have four children. She is responsible for paying the household expenses. She plans to use the loan to buy larger quantities of rice and other ingredients to increase the volume of food she can sell. She plans to save any additional profits she makes for her family’s future. She also wants to invest in the sale of salt.
She is showing some bags of beans.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of rice and other ingredients to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa A. sells provisions, including snacks and soaps, amongst other things. She’s been running this business for two years now, at Jukwa, near Abura, Cape Coast. Her husband is a farmer and they have five children. With her earnings, she helps pay for the household expenses. She plans to expand her business by growing the sales of provisions. Her loan will be used to purchase larger quantities of goods, which she buys from Takoradi, a town about a couple of hours away. She plans to save up the extra proftts she earns from her expanded business.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of goods to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel S. tiene 37 años de edad y está casado con la señora Ninfa Gomez, quien tiene 34 años de edad, ambos de la ciudad de Caacupe, distante a unos 60 kilómetros de la ciudad capital (Asunción). Tienen 1 hijo y 2 hijas (todos en edad Escolar).
El señor Manuel S. cuenta en su domicilio con una hamburguesería desde hace 6 años. Donde trabaja con toda su familia.
Por más que el señor Manuel y su esposa trabajen mucho poseen algunas necesidades que satisfacer. Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas e insumos para sus hamburguesas, ya que la compra en cantidad disminuye el costo de los productos.
Agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya y Kiva el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello su negocio está creciendo, brindando productos de excelente calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel S., 37, is married to Mrs. Ninfa Gómez, 34.  They are both from the city of Caacupe located about 60 kilometers from the capital, Asunción.  They have one son and two daughters, all school age.

Mr. Manuel S. has had a hamburger stand at his house for the last 6 years; he works there with his entire family.

Despite his and his wife’s hard work they still have some unmet needs.  He is asking for a loan to buy beverages and ingredients for the hamburgers because buying in bulk reduces costs of the products.

He thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support given for his business because, thanks to it, his business is growing providing his customers with products of excellent quality.

loans.use: to buy beverages and ingredients for his hamburgers.

loans.name: Turqueza 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama TURQUEZA 1, porque viven en un lugar donde en el mar el aguas es de color turquesas, la arena y el sol se dan a conocer por si solos. Está ubicado en el estado de Quintana Roo, Cancún en México. El grupo está conformado por 8 integrantes. La señora María Guadalupe M. T., es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 26 años, estudió la secundaria, es ama de casa tiene y 1 solo hija de 6 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo, desde hace 1 año y medio. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en calzado y sacar los pedidos. La señora va de casa en casa promoviendo sus calzados y trata de tener sus pedidos en la fecha que sus clientes se lo soliciten para darles un mejor servicio. Doña Lupita se siente muy motivada y contenta porque con este préstamo ella podrá invertir en sus ganancias y espera brindarles educación a sus hijos para que tengan una mejor vida.
texts.en: This group is named “Turquoise” because they live in a place where the ocean is a turquoise color and the sun and sand are well known. It is located in the state of Quintana Roo, Cancun, Mexico. This group is made up of eight members. Mrs. María Guadalupe is the president of the group. She is 26 years old, studies in the secondary school, and is a housewife with one six year old daughter. For the past year and a half she has been selling shoes from a catalogue. She is asking for this loan in order to buy the shoes and obtain more orders. This woman goes from door to door selling her shoes. She tries to get the shoes delivered by the date that her customers expect them to arrive, in order to provide her customers with good service. Mrs. Lupita feels very motivated and happy because with this loan she is able to invest her earnings and hopefully give her children a good education so that they can have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro tiene 22 años, su pareja es Mary Paredes y aún no tienen hijos. Es comerciante desde hace 3 años, realiza sus ventas en forma directa y también en forma de pedidos en las despensas, cuenta con clientela formada a quienes en forma semanal los visita dependiendo de la zona en que le toque trabajar.
Empezó con la ayuda de su padre, quien le brindó un pequeño capital para comprar en forma diaria sus mercaderías e ir vendiendo por los barrios, pues sin vehículo salía a realizar sus ventas caminando y si debía irse a zonas más lejanas se manejaba en colectivo, posteriormente sus ventas se vieron en alza y optó por retirar una motocicleta de una casa comercial que le permitió abrir oportunidades de negocio en zonas más lejanas aún y formar una clientela, con quienes se encuentra trabajando sin ningún problema.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por la oportunidad de solicitar el préstamo pues con ello podría comprar chupetines, caramelos, galletitas, pilas y afeitadoras, entre otras cosas; para aumentar sus ingresos y poder estar preparado para formar una familia.
El cree que pocas organizaciones ofrecen la oportunidad de progresar económicamente tal como lo hace Kiva.
texts.en:
Isidro is 22 years old; his partner is Mary Paredes, and they have no children as yet.  For 3 years he has been a merchant, selling directly and through orders placed at stores.  He has a regular customer base, whom he visits weekly, depending on the area where he is working at the time.
He started out with help from his father, who gave him a small sum to buy his merchandise daily and go around selling in the various neighborhoods.  With no vehicle, he would sell his goods on foot, and if he needed to travel to more remote areas, he used buses.  His sales subsequently increased, and he chose to take out a motorcycle from a dealer, which enabled him to develop business opportunities in areas that were even more remote, and build customers, with whom he continues to work with no problems.
He is grateful to the Paraguayan Foundation and Kiva for the trust shown in granting him a loan, since he will be able to buy candies of various types, cookies, batteries, and shavers. This helps him to increase his income and be prepared to start a family. He believes that there are few organizations that offer the opportunity to progress economically like Kiva does.

loans.use: To buy candies, shavers, batteries, cleaning items, etc.

loans.name: Sara Isabel

texts.es:
Sara de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un taller de costura y confección, para tener ingresos adicionales vende productos de uso personal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar trabajando en el aunque se le ha hecho difícil trabajar debido a que está separada. Su horario de trabajo es de las 15h00pm hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Elabora pijamas, camisas, pantalones etc. Con el préstamo desea comprar telas, botones, hilos.
texts.en:
Sara is 35 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who owns a sewing and dressmaking workshop.  In order to make additional income she sells personal care products such as perfume, creams, deodorants, etc.

Sara has a lot of aspirations for her business and she would like to continue working in it even though it has become difficult for her to work owing to the fact that she is separated.  Sara works from 3.00pm to 10.00pm every day.  She makes pajamas, shirts, pants, etc.  She would like to use her loan money to buy fabric, buttons and threads.

loans.use: to buy fabric and buttons

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
La Sra. Marcela B. es cliente antigua  de nuestra entidad, es casada y vive en casa propia.
La titular  se dedica a la renta desde hace 5 años, el domicilio que renta está en la ciudad de Luque, comprende una vivienda y un depósito. La titular ha retirado dicho préstamo para la refracción de dicha vivienda.
La titular considera que este préstamo le dará una mejor atención a sus clientes y a su vez le dejará mejor ingreso posteriormente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marcela B. is a long-standing client of our entity; she’s married and lives in her own house.

For five years she’s been a landlord.  She has a place she rents out in the city of Luque consisting of a house and a grocery store.  She has taken out a loan to refurbish said house.  She thinks that the loan will allow her to provide better customer service and subsequently improved income.

loans.use: to do some home repairs

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, tiene 68 años, es una mujer jovial y optimista. Es separada, vive en su casa propia con su hijo mayor de nombre José, de los 6 que tiene, y su nieto Jeremy de 13 años, quien es su engreído. Esta emprendedora madre de familia, con mucho esfuerzo forjó su bodega y la hizo prospera, asimismo compró su carro, herramienta que le sirvió para sacar adelante a sus hijos, que ahora son  personas de bien y trabajadoras. Sin embargo enfermó por mucho tiempo, por lo que poco a poco su tienda fracasó manteniendo sólo el carro, en donde su hijo lo utilizó. Desde entonces, y alrededor de 7 años, ella administra las ganancias que recibe al ofrecer el servicio de transporte, actualmente logró darle mantenimiento técnico a su vehículo. Está  convencida que de seguir trabajando y cuidando de su salud,  mas adelante podrá tener nuevamente  su bodega que tanto le gusta y anhela, “a pesar de ser muy esclavizada”, acotó. Pero, por el momento su mayor prioridad  es llevar al taller de mecánica a su carro, para que su hijo continúe  trabajando sin dificultad. Es su 13avo crédito que tiene con MFP, y dice “que confíen en ella, ya que pagará todas sus cuotas como ejemplo de la líder de todo este tiempo de su grupo comunal, a quienes les estima mucho por su apoyo”. Con el crédito que solicita, realizará mantenimiento mecánico a su carro, para que continúe trabajando y generando buenas utilidades.
texts.en:
68 year-old Jesús is a jovial and optimistic woman.  She is separated and lives in her own home with her eldest son called José (she has 6 children in all).  She also lives with her 13 year-old grandson Jeremy who is her treasure.  This enterprising mother, through a lot of hard work, set up a small grocery store and made it prosper.  She also bought a car, a tool with which she has managed to get her children ahead in life.  Her children are now good, hard-working people.  However, Jesús was sick for a long time and, as a result, her store gradually failed.  She only had her car left and her son used it.

For approximately 7 years, Jesús has been managing the profits that she receives from offering a transport service.  She recently managed to renew her car.  She is convinced that if she continues to work and look after her health, in the future she will be able to re-open her store which she likes so much and she wishes for this "in spite of the fact that it is very enslaving".

At the moment, Jesús' main priority is to have her car serviced so that her son can continue to work without difficulty. She has set an example as the leader of her community bank during this time.  Her fellow members like her a lot for the support she has provided.

Jesús will use the loan she is requesting to have her car serviced so that her son can continue working and making good profits.

loans.use: to have her car serviced

loans.name: Eunice Del Socorro

texts.es:
Eunice Castellar  es una mujer que vive en la ciudad de  Cartagena muy cerca a escenarios deportivos, allí    en esta bella vende mercancías variadas, negocio con el apoya los ingresos del hogar  conformado por  su esposo  y dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 6 años.
Eunice inició aprendió esta actividad  con su mamá, cuando viajaba al departamento de la Guajira y traían mercancía que vendía en un mercado muy doméstico,  es decir entre parientes y vecinas cercana;  y una vez su madre se retiró de su negocio, ya Eunice había logrado consolidar un mercado mayor y logró con su trabajo obtener un pequeño capital,  este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, pues   tiene encargadas entre sus clientes y algunos nuevos a los que está conquistando; Eunice  dice que su negocio ha logrado tener una independencia económica con sus ingresos teniendo en cuenta que ella y su esposo tienen muchos sueños  de brindar bienestar a su familia y cuando sus hijos crezcan, darles oportunidades de estudios superiores. Ahora su meta es diversificar porque su clientela pide cada día otros productos como el calzado deportivo y quiere vendérselos a ella mediante sistema de crédito también. 
Su principal desafío es la falta de capital para responder a la demanda del mercado por eso está solicitando un financiamiento a la Fundación mediante con el cual comprará ropa femenina e infantil y también para caballeros.
texts.en:
Eunice Castellar is a woman living in the city of Cartagena very near to sports venues.  She sells assorted goods in this beautiful place.  The business helps meet household expenses.  Her family consists of her husband and two children who are 3 and 6 years of age.

Eunice initially learned this occupation from her mother.  They would travel to the La Guajira Department to bring merchandise to sell at a very domestic marketplace, that is, among family members and nearby neighbors.  Once her mother retired from the business and Eunice had managed to secure a larger market she managed to amass a small bit of capital.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy clothes for women, children and men because she has pending orders from customers as well as new customers she’s winning over.

Eunice says that income from the business has provided her with economic independence since she and her husband very much want to provide wellbeing for their family so that when the children grow up they can provide higher education for them.  Her goal now is to diversify because her clientele is asking for other items every day like athletic shoes, for example, and she wants to sell them on credit.

Her main challenge is the lack of capital to respond to market demand.  This is why she’s asking the Fundación for a loan to be able to buy clothing for women, children and men; this is the reason for her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for women, children and men.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
El señor Dario D. está casado con la señora Wilma Rodriguez, con quien tiene dos hijos.
Hace aproximadamente 26 años don Dario era tractorista en una estancia en el Chaco, como en la misma no tenía luz eléctrica él se las tuvo que ingeniar para poder tener luz. Fue así que empezó a experimentar haciendo reactancias y difusor, conectando los mismos por la batería del tractor.
Hace 25 años se casó y decidió venir a la zona central con su señora y empezar así su mini empresa.
Hoy día practicamente es el único que fabrica las reactancias y los difusores para ómnibus.
Los créditos que retira siempre son para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Mr. Darío Domínguez is married to Mrs. Wilma Rodríguez; they have two children.

Approximately 26 years ago Darío was a tractor operator in a large farm in El Chaco.  Because the farm was not electrified he had to figure out a way to have electricity.  He started experimenting making inductors and diffusers which he would connect to the tractor’s battery.

Twenty-five years ago he married and decided to move to the central zone with his wife and start his mini business.  Today he’s practically the only one who manufactures inductors and diffusers for buses.  All the loans he takes out are sued to buy raw materials.

loans.use: to buy plaster, magnets, diodes and transistors.

loans.name: Clemencia Victoria

texts.es:
Clemencia Victoria R. M. tiene 42 años, Es Viuda vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Clemencia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es incrementar el negocio.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Clemencia Victoria Rodríguez M., 42, is a widow living with her two children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province. 

The members of the “SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS” communal bank located in Amarillos which belongs to Ventanas Canton are short cycle corn and rice farmers.

Clemencia farms corn and rice.  She buys her products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.

She is requesting the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for her crops.   Support from the loan will help her economically to meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are infestations, illnesses and the variations in the weather.  

Her dream is to expand her business.  She enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Odalia Alexandra

texts.es:
Odalia Alexandra tiene 22 años, Es soltera vive con los padres y los con el  hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE DE LOS AMARILLOS se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Odalia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ampliar la casa.

Le gusta ver la televisión.

loans.name: Valentina Del Carmen

texts.es: Valentina de 36 años de edad casado, labora para el MINED  de Juigalpa desde hace 16 años como docente. Esta solicitando su 7mo. credito con el objetivo terminar de un cuarto anexo a su casa ponerle las mochetas, persianas y repellar las paredes y brindarle a su familia  mejores condiciones de vida.  Cabe mencionar que el credito anterior lo utilizo para reparar el sistema electrico de su casa y ademas instalo el servicio de agua potable, expresa sentirse agradecida con AFODENIC y KIVA, pues gracias al apoyo brindado pudo hacer lo que necesitaba en su casa.
texts.en: Valentina is 36 years old and is married. She has been working for MINED of Juigalpa for 16 years as a teacher. She is requesting her 7th loan with the goal of completing a fourth annex to her house, by putting in the molding and baseboards, windows, and plaster the walls so she can give her family better living conditions. This is a good place to mention that she used her previous loan to repair her house’s electrical system and also to install running water. She says she is grateful to AFODENIC and Kiva, since with their help she was able to do what she needed in her house.

loans.use: to plaster her walls and put in windows

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is 45 years old, married, and has five children who are all studying. She owns a grocery store in Ayacucho and will be using her loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase rice, sugar and other supplies for the store. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years now. She previously had a business selling cheese, and then she sold clothing. She prefers running the grocery store as she does not have to travel around as much. Delfina would like to increase the quantity of products that she sells and to start to act as a distributor.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and other supplies.

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
La Señora. Ana A. es socia del banco comunal Tocte, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre que pertenece a la parroquia de Jadan, su gente se dedica la cría de animales y a la  agricultura, muchos laboran en artesanías, cuenta con hermosos paisajes, su gente es amable y cordial.

Doña Ana tiene 25 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 10, 8, 6 y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian  en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora en la elaboración de estucos (cielos rasos), con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Ana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a al cuidado de sus hijos, también cría animales como: cuyes y pollos los que vende en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en su sexto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes y alimento de los mismos. Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana A. is a member of the Tocte communal bank.  She lives in a community with the same name that belongs to Jadan Parish.  Its residents raise animals and farm.  Many are craftspeople.  It has beautiful scenery and its residents are kind and cordial.

Ana is 25 years old, married and has four children who are 10, 8, 6 and 3 years of age.  The three oldest go to the local little elementary school.  Her husband works installing stucco ceilings.  Their joint work as a couple has made it possible for them to build their own house.

Ana dedicates herself to household chores and to caring for her children.  She also raises animals like guinea pigs and chickens that she sells in her community.

This is her sixth loan with the communal bank.  The new loan will be used to buy chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed for them.  Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: David Roseli

texts.es:
David tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. Viven en el distrito de La Victoria,  una zona urbana que cuenta con agua potable y energía electricidad, sin embargo bajo condiciones humildes.
Desde hace 6 años, David se dedica a la renovación y confección de calzados. Aprendió este rubro de su padre. Cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes. 

Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de material para confeccionar calzados. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles. Posee buenas referencias laborales y personales de su comunidad urbana.
texts.en:
David is 24 years old, single, and lives in his parents' home.  They live in La Victoria district, an urban area that has access to drinking water and electricity.  However, it is a poor area.

For 6 years, David has been repairing and making footwear.  He learned this trade from his father.  He has a good customer base.

David would like to invest his loan in buying material for making footwear.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He has good work references and personal references from his community.

loans.use: to buy material for making footwear

loans.name: Henry Antonio

texts.es: Henry de 45 años de edad casado, labora para ALcaldia de Juigalpa como maestro de Obra desde hace 2 años. Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo cambiar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado, pues como estamos en verano es mas facil cambiarlo para cuando llegue el invierno evitar que se le moje su casa. Cabe señalar que el credito anterior lo utilizo para cercar su propiedad.
texts.en: Henry, who is 45 years old and married, has worked as a project supervisor for the Mayor's Office of Juigalpa for the last 2 years.  He is requesting his 2nd loan with the purpose of replacing the roof of his house which is in bad repair.  Since it is currently summer, it it easier to replace it now than when winter comes and his house would get wet.  It is worth noting that the previous loan was used to fence in his property.

loans.use: to replace his roof.

loans.name: Zoila María

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila T. es socia del banco comunal Tocte, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y  pertenece a la parroquia de Jadan,   su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en artesanías, cuenta con hermosos paisajes, su gente es amable y cordial.

La Señora. Zoila tiene 50 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 23, 20, 19, 15 y 10 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y el ayudan económicamente, su cuarto hijo pasa en la casa y es quien le ayuda a cultivar la tierra y su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como albañil, con el sacrificio de los dos han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Zoila se dedica a la agricultura,  siembra hortalizas y verduras las que son para su consumo y para la venta, también cría animales como: pollos y chanchos.

Se encuentra en su sexto crédito los mismos que le han permitido crecer en la cría de animales y con este nuevo crédito va ha comprar mas chanchos. Su meta es  construir un reservorio de agua y terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Zoila T. is a member of the Tocte community bank.  She lives in the community of Tocte, in Jadan parish.  People in this area raise animals and farm crops.  Many are craftspeople.  The area has beautiful landscapes and the local people are kind and friendly.

Zoila is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children aged 23, 20, 19, 15 and 10.  Her three eldest children work and help her financially.  Her fourth child is at home and helps her cultivate her land.  Her youngest child attends a local school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  With a lot of sacrifice, the two of them have managed to build their own home.

Zoila is a farmer.  She grows greens and vegetables for her own consumption and to sell.  She also raises animals such as chickens and pigs.

This is Zoila's sixth loan.  Her previous loans have allowed her to grow in her animal-raising business and she will use this new loan to buy more pigs.  Her goal is to build a water reservoir and to finish off her house.

loans.use: to buy pigs
