MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
texts.en:
In 1994 three years after the collapse of USSR and the beginning of the reform, the family of Nazarkulovs was given a plot of land in several hectares. Being used to working for the collective good, for Nazarkulovs it was new to start their own business. Anarhan N. is 53 years old, she is a leader of this group. At her husband's initiative was the first to buy 2000 soms worth of cattle for breeding. Because agriculture is a seasonal source of income, animal husbandry turned out to be a good addition to the family's savings account. The winter time is a time off from agriculture, but Anarhan now has to take care of the animals. During winter the animals need special care more than in the summer time when the cattle can take care of itself.

Anarhan's husband is a hydraulics technician, they have a fifteen year old daughter who is financially dependent on them. Their older son is 25 and works in the Tashkumyrskiy GAO and also provides his share in the development of their family business.

The fifteen year term has justified Anarhan's anticipation. At this time the agriculture business together with animal husbandry bring Anarhan around 9500 soms of monthly income. As all the other farmers Anarhan is anxiously waiting for the beginning of the sowing season. The purchase of the fertilizer will be her main expense and this is why she wants to take out the loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for sowing

loans.name: Liberthe

texts.en:
Liberthe is 41 years old and married with five children who are between 18 and 21 years old. Liberthe is commonly known for selling drinks (PRIMUS and MITZIIG,VIN) and she has been in this business for about five years. Liberthe opens her shop from 7am until 9 pm every day.

Liberthe has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company hoping that she can increase her profits by expanding her business. With the use of this loan, Liberthe will also start roasting meat to sell to her customers. A large number of her customers have requested this. Liberthe hopes that through the expansion of her business, she will start creating some other sources of income as well creating more jobs for the people in her community.

loans.use: To buy more beer and start roasting meat to sell.

loans.name: Uulzhan's Group

texts.ru:
Уулжан Калманбетова, 49, лидер этой группы. Неудивительно, что ей пришлось собрать такую удачную группу предпринимателей, ведь она во всем Ташкумыре славится высочайшими успехами в разведении и продаже скота. Уулжан с теплом вспоминает приобретение самого первого теленка 26 лет тому назад.  Тогда ей были свойственны неуверенность и сомнение в успехе этого дела, но теперь она является одной из самых успешных скотоводов в округе. Уулжан имеет большое хозяйство в 3 головы коровы, 11 голов телят и 30 голов мелкорогатого скота. Супруг Уулжан также опытен в животноводстве. По профессии он педагог и преподает в ташкумырской школе. Вечернего времени и выходных ему достаточно, чтобы подготовить живность к продаже в местном скотном рынке. 16летний ребенок Уулжан – единственный иждивенец, так как старшие уже работают. Большую часть 9 500 сомов ежемесячного дохода, семья вкладывает в покупку корма. Теперь им бы хотелось выйти на следующий уровень и еще больше повысить число живности. Уулжан очень верит в получение этого кредита, который поможет ей купит больше голов скота и расширит свое хозяйство. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
texts.en:
Uulzhan K., 49 years old, is this group’s leader. It is not suprising that she managed to bring together such a good group of entrepreneurs, since she is well known in all of Taskhomer for her success in raising and selling livestock. She warmly remembers buying her very first calf 26 years ago.

Back then, she was unsure of herself and doubtful of the outcome, but now she is one of the most successful animal farmers in the region. She has a big farm: three cows, 11 calves and 30 goats and sheep. Uulzhan’s husband also has a lot of experience in raising livestock. He is an educator by profession and works as a schoolteacher in Tashkomer. Evenings and weekends he has enough time to prepare animals for sale at the local animal market. Uulzhan’s 16-year old child is the only dependent, as her older children already work. The family invests a large part of their 9,500-som monthly income into buying animal feed. At present they would like to take their business to the next level and to increase their livestock. Uulzhan puts her trust in this loan, which will allow her buy more animals and expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La Sra. Angela  tiene 40 años y  está casada con el Sr. Lucio E. D. 51 años, cuentan con 5 hijos (3 varones y 2 mujeres).
Siempre se dedicó al comercio, con el tiempo abrió su propia despensa, y su marido es constructor especialista en colocación D. pisos pero actualmente se dedica a la artesanía: sombreros, pantallas (especie D. abanico tradicional), escobas D. Palma (Karanday). Son personas muy humildes D. escasos recursos con ganas D. prosperar.
Le gustaría que sus productos se conozcan más en el extranjero poder exportar, pero ahora su prioridad es su despensa por eso solicita el préstamo, para poder comprar muchos comestibles y venderlos, a fin D. obtener medios económicos para superar la pobreza.
texts.en:
Sra. Angela is 40 years old and married to Sr. Lucio E., age 51. They have five children, three sons and two daughters.

Sra. Angela has always engaged in traD., but she eventually opened her own food pantry. Her husband is a builder who specializes in multi-story structures, but currently makes handicrafts such as hats, traditional fans, and palm brooms. Even though they are humble people with limited resources, Angela and her husband want to prosper.

Their products have been exported and are well-known abroad. However, her food pantry is her priority, so Angela is requesting a loan to buy more food products to sell. This will give her the financial means to overcome poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 47 years old and is married with three children who are between 10 and 22 years old. Beatrice makes her living by sewing different styles of clothes.  She has been in business for one year.. She operates her business from 8am until 6h30pm every day. 

Beatrice is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. to purchase two sewing machines and some clothing items. Thus, she will create two jobs for the people in her community.

By expanding her business and adding more equipment and workers, Beatrice will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to create other areas of the same business. In addition, she and her family will be able to get their own shelter.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and cloth.

loans.name: Kebei

texts.en:
J. was born in 1976, and she is married to Kebei Henry. They are blessed with seven children; three of them are below the age of 15 and they are living in Ndamukong Street, a quarter in Bamenda, in the North West Region of Cameroon.

J.  has faced some major challenges in her life: sickness, poverty  and moreover, she never had the opportunity to attend school for very long. The most difficult have been the problem of raising capital for her business and  paying for her children’s education.  She plans to invest this loan in the buying and fattening of piglets, purchase of pig feed, and construction of a pig sty. She will be able to raise a lot of profit from the business because it highly demanded in her community. 

She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time and she is having experience as far as the business is concerned. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least good pork meat for their meals, and people of the North West region of Cameroon respect pork meats a lot to carry out their traditional rites. So the business will be sustainable. 

Jeannette will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children's school fees and save for a rainy day. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the method in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Frugence

texts.en: Frugence is a forty eight year old married man living in Kasese Uganda .He is charged with the responsibility of taking care of his ten children and his dream is to educate them up to university.For ten years he has been farming and the proceeds have helped him to meet the basic needs of his family despite challenges in seasonal changes.Frugence needs the loan facility to prepare land for growing irish potatoes.

loans.use: Growing irish potatoes

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary wants a loan to buy more shoes for resale. She lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda.She has been selling shoes  for the last five years and her desire is to become a large scale trader of shoes and educating her children.Rosemary needs the loan to buy shoes for resale.

loans.use: Buying  shoes for resell

loans.name: Lukong

texts.en:
H. was born in 1978. She is single and a mother of two children both below the age of 15. They are living in Foncha Street, a quarter in Nkwen, Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.

Henritta has faced some major challenges in her life: sickness, poverty  and moreover, she never had the opportunity to attend school all the way through .The most difficult have been the problem of raising capital for her business and  paying for her children’s education.  She plans to invest this loan in rearing pigs, selling local beer called "sha" produced from corn, and selling firewood. In the production of Piglets and firewood, she will be able to raise a lot of profit from the business because they are highly demanded in her community. She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time and has experience as far as the business is concerned. 

She also thinks her approach to her customers will be captivating and hence lead to the success of her business. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford at least good pigs (pock meat) for their meals, and the North West region of Cameroon respects pigs (pock meat) a lot to carry out their traditional rites. So her business will be sustainable. And also, she will provide her community with good firewood which they will use as fuel for cooking.

H. will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children's school fees and save some for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back the loan.

About GHAPE 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed,  firewood, and corn.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en: Winfred is a nursing assistant in Kyenjojo-Uganda . For three years she has been operating a drug shop and the business has allowed her to pay school fees for her children.She has a challenge of limited drugs to treat her clients and her desire is to set up a phamarcy and use the profits for educating her children. Winfred intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en: Evalyne is a forty two year old divorced woman with three children living in her own house in Kasese Uganda. She has been dealing in secondhand clothes for the last ten years in which she started with a capital of 100,000 shillings and his current working capital is 2,000,000 shillings. Her hardship is high transport costs and her vision is wholesale business and a peaceful home.Evalyne needs the loan to buy second hand clothes for sell.

loans.use: Buying second hand clothes

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a forty six year old married man with five children.  He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda, and has been in retail for two years.  He was initially in farming, from where he mobilized the capital for the retail business. The biggest challenge for his business is bad debtors.   He envisions having a big retail business in future and he also hopes to purchase a motorcycle.  John is requesting this loan to buy sugar and soap for retail sale.

loans.use: To buy sugar and soap for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Dan is a twenty nine year old married man with two children, who owns a house in Kasese Uganda. He has been in the soft drinks business for fifteen years. He started the business with 200,000 shillings and expanded to 2,000,000 shillings.  His biggest challenge is sometimes being attacked by thieves.  His vision is business expansion and buying a car.  Dan is requesting the loan to buy soft drinks for sale.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks for sale.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a fifty year old married man with six children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a farmer for ten years.  He started with growing twenty bags of coffee and now does forty bags. His biggest challenge in farming is crop diseases.   His vision is processing the coffee and educating his children.  Fred needs the loan to buy a pulping machine.

loans.use: to buy a pulping machine.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 25 years old, married, and has two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He owns a retail shop, which he has operated for the past four years. Prior to opening his shop, he was a farmer. He saved money in order to open his retail shop. His hardships are debtors, price fluctuations, and high transportation costs. His vision is to expand his business and to educate his children. Samuel intends to use the loan to buy sugar, rice, soda, and soap as inventory for his shop.

loans.use: To buy inventory of sugar, rice, soda, and soap for his shop

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Living in his own house in Kasese, Uganda, Wilson, a 47-year-old married man with nine children, has been selling clothes and bags for three years after saving money from coffee farming. His vision consists of operating a wholesale business and educating his children. Wilson is requesting this loan to buy clohes and bags to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and bags to sell

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ar: عزيزة في عمر 44 سنة متزوجة ولها وله اولاد تعمل في محل بيع البسة واحذية اوروبية مستعملة لها في عملها 5 سنوات تحب عملها وتتقنه جيدا دائمة التطور والتجدد فهي نشيطة ومثابرة تحب ان تزيد من مدخول محلها فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة وتوسيع المحل من خلالها تطوير عائلتها وتطوير نفسها خاصة انها هي من تساعد عائلتها على زيادة مدخولهم وتكوين نفسهم
texts.en: Aziza is 44 years old and married with children. She works in a store which sells used European clothing and shoes. She has worked there for five years and likes her work, which she performs well. She is always improving and developing her business, as she is very energetic and diligent. With a loan from al-Majmoua she would like to increase her income from the store by buying new merchandise and expanding her store. In doing so, she hopes to develop herself and her family, especially since she is the one responsible for helping her family to increase their income and to shape themselves for the future.

loans.use: To expand her store by purchasing new merchandise

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward, a 53-year-old married man with five children, owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Edward has operated a retail shop for 20 years; he started with capital of 100,000 shillings and now has 2,000,000 shillings. His vision is to expand the business and build a better home. Edward needs the loan to buy soap, cooking oil and match boxes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase soap, cooking oil and match boxes to sell

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline is a forty one year old married woman with eleven children and she owns a house in Kasese Uganda. She has been in a hair salon business for four years. Her biggest challenge is lack of capital for her business.   Her vision is salon expansion and educating her children.  Joseline needs the loan to buy a hair dryer and weaves.

loans.use: to buy hair dryer and weaves for the salon

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a thirty three year old married man, with three children and owns a house in Kasese Uganda. He has been in agriculture for five years, which he started with capital of 500,000 shillings and has now increased to 2,500,000 shillings.  His biggest challenge is price fluctuation and his vision is selling sixty sacks of coffee per month.  He also envisions a well educated family.  Wilson needs the loan to renovate his coffee store.

loans.use: to renovate his coffee store

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 33-year-old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Moses has been running a retail shop for two years. His hardship is little capital and his vision is to expand his business and educate his children. Moses needs this loan to buy Omo (detergent), sugar and toothpaste to sell.

loans.use: to buy Omo, sugar and toothpaste to sell

loans.name: San Paulo Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Lilian Josefina C., quien invitó y organizó a sus amigas para formar parte del programa "Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras".
La sra. Estelvina G. C. posee un despensa donD. lleva a cabo la venta D. comestibles y helados; está en pareja desD. hace 12 años con el señor Dionisio Benitez, quien se dedica a la albañilería, tienen seis hijos estudiantes, dos en la secundaria y cuatro en la primaria.
La señora Estelvina retiró el crédito para la compra D. mercaderías para cargar su despensa (azúcar, yerba, harina, panificados, bebidas, etc.). Ellos sueñan con ampliar su negocio y brindar lo mejor a sus hijos en cuanto a vivienda, educación y salud.
texts.en:
The person who started this existing committee is Sra. Lilian Josefina C.. She invited her friends and organized them to form a group as part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program.

Sra. Estelvina G. C. has a food pantry where she sells groceries and ice cream. Her partner for the past twelve years is Sr. Dionisio Benitez, who works in masonry. They have six school age children, two in high school and four in elementary school.

Sra. Estelvina has taken this loan to buy merchandise to restock her food pantry such as sugar, herbs, flour, baked goods, beverages, and other products. She dreams of expanding her business and providing the best for her children in terms of shelter, education, and health.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, herbs, flour, baked goods, beverages, and other products.

loans.name: Développement Plus Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline M. is the manager of the Community Bank named “Développement Plus”. It is composed of 17 members, united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Jacqueline started her business selling loaves of bread. Today, she operates a general store. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of six children whose ages are between 9 and 30. Three of them go to school. She has already received  the MFI HOPE DRC loans six times and fully repaid them. 

With the profit of about $25 earned per week, she intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her business by buying canned goods, sugar, sacks of rice and beans and other store items to resell at profit. 

Currently, Jacqueline is happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups because her business has been reinforced through the loans she has received. Her dream is to someday become a wholesaler. She sells in the western area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, sugar, sacks of rice and beans and other items.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Gaspard

texts.fr: Gaspard K. est secrétaire exécutif pour le district de Kicukiro à Kigali, et client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Il a 65 ans, il est marie, et ne a Rwanda.  Il a 3 enfants enter 8 ans et 11 ans, et tous vont a l’école.  Gaspard lui-même a une éducation d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son 2eme cycle avec ACB, et il a une bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour la réhabilitation d’une maison d’habitation.  Sa strategie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de rembourser bien ce crédit, tout en sollicitant les autres crédits en vue de construire une autre maison de louer.  Il voudrait avoir une bonne maison d’habitation pour sa famille.  Il voudrait aussi assurer le bien être de sa famille, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Gaspard K. is an executive secretary for the Kicukiro district in Kigali and a cline of ACB since 2007. He is 65 and married. He was born in Rwanda. He has three children between 8 and 11 years of age, and all go to school. Gaspard himself has received secondary education. This loan is his second cycle with ACB, and he has a good payment history. He will use his loan in order to renovate his house. His business strategy is to repay this loan properly and to keep taking out loans in order to build another house he could rent out. He would like to have a good house for his family to live in. He would  also like to ensure the well-being of his family and pay for the education of his children.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Rasto Kimutai

texts.en:
Rasto Kimutai is 23 years old farmer and he is married to Mercy Jerop who runs a salon in the nearby trading centre. Kimutai has been in the farming business for a period of two years and his monthly income from this is Ksh 10,000.   

Kimutai has borrowed a loan of Ksh. 40,000, this being his second loan, after successfully repaying his first  loan. The money will be used to purchase one dairy cow and animal feeds. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to improve the welfare of his family and also improve his dairy farm.  
  

His future dreams are to own a motorbike which will assist him transport milk to the KCC plant.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and animal feeds

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Atanasia E. D. R., quien invitó y organizó a sus amigas para formar parte del programa "Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras".
La sra. Atanasia E. se dedica a la costura y elaboración D. sombreros D. karanday junto con su esposo, el señor Dionisio R., con quien está casada desD. hace 25 años, tienen dos hijos estudiantes.
La señora Atanasia retiró el crédito para la compra D. sus materiales D. trabajo como por ejemplo telas, hilos, gomas, tijera, Karanday, etc.
texts.en:
The person who started this existing committee is Sra. Atanasia E. D. R.. She invited her friends and organized them to form a group as part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program.

Sra. Atanasia E. engages in sewing and making hats out of “karanday” (a natural palm fiber) with her husband, Sr. Dionisio R.. They have been married for 25 years and have two children in school. Sra. Atanasia is taking this loan to buy materials for her work such as fabrics, thread, rubber, zippers, palm fiber, and other items.

loans.use: To purchase supplies such as fabrics, thread, rubber, zippers, palm fiber, and other materials.

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: Monique N. est enseignante, et client d’ACB depuis 2007.  Elle a 24 ans, elle est célibataire, et elle est née à Rwanda.  Ce prêt est son 4eme cycle avec ACB, et elle a bien remboursée ses prêts.  Elle a fini ses études jusqu’au niveau A2, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour payer les frais d’études universitaire.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de terminer ses études universitaires.  Elle voudrait avoir le niveau de licence pour son activité d’enseignante, et construire une belle maison.
texts.en:
Monique N. is a teacher. She joined ACB in 2007. She is 24 years old, single, and was born in Rwanda. 


This is her 4th loan cycle with ACB, and previous loans were repaid without incident. She completed A2 level studies, and plans to use her loan to pay for her university tuition fees. 


Her strategy is to finish her university studies. She wants to get her teaching license, and build a beautiful house.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition fees

loans.name: Kutesa United Group-Mukono

texts.en: Fifty-year-old S. Ahamada has been operating a business farming and selling coffee for the past decade in Buyiri-Katete in Mukono. The happily married father of four says he was inspired by one of his closest friends to try a hand at this business, which can be lucrative if one works at it with determination. Coffee is a high value cash crop in Uganda, despite the seasonal changing prices. Ahamada experiences both great and poor sales seasons. He is also a qualified teacher who still finds time to teach. His business generates 75,000 UGX as weekly profits. Ahamada is requesting this loan to purchase more bags of coffee to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of coffee to resell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Grace has a business selling craft items, which she has had for two years.

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more craft items for resale.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Grace hopes to start exporting crafts to other countries.

loans.use: to purchase more craft items for resale.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica N. is 50 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is widowed and has six children.  None of her children is currently in school.  Jessica has a business of selling food produce, which she has had for over 10 years.

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more maize for resale.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Jessica hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and take care of herself.  In the future, Jessica hopes to become one of the biggest suppliers of maize.

loans.use: to purchase more maize for resale.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses S. is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has six children.  Five of his children are currently in school.  Moses has a poultry farm, which he has had for eight years.

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more poultry feed for the chickens.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Moses hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Moses hopes to expand his business into a big poultry farm.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Ethemie Christine

texts.fr:
cliente de 34ans célibataire et mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie de 12ans à 17ans. en 1995 elle ouvre sa cabine téléphonique. 
avec ce prêt elle compte acheter des cartes a, warid, MTN et deux téléphones afin de renforcer son activité.
ses ambitions sont d'ouvrir une magasin de vente de téléphone, ouvrir une boutique d'habillement ainsi que voyager afin d'importer la marchandise.
elle souhaite encadrer sa famille dans le commerce, construire une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ethemie Christine O. is 34 years old, single, and the mother of two children, aged 12 and 17. In 1995, she opened her phone booth. With this loan, she intends to buy phone cards from operators Warid and MTN, as well as to phones, in order to bolster her business.

She ambitions to open her own phone store and a clothing boutique, as well as to travel to import products. She also wants to help her family in the business, and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy phone cards

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child, who is not in school.  Florence has a clinic, which she has had for less than one year.

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase medicine for resale.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and take care of her self.  In the future, Florence hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for resale.

loans.name: Mirtha Graciela

texts.es:
La señorita Mirtha R. J. vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Ybycui, es madre soltera de una niña y es contadora desde hace más de 2 años.
Ella nos cuenta que le resultaba muy difícil estudiar ya que tenía que viajar a otra ciudad para hacerlo.
Con mucho sacrificio y con la ayuda de sus padres logró culminar sus estudios después de 4 años, luego de terminar su carrera empezó a buscar un lugar donde trabajar para así cubrir sus gastos y la de su hija. Al no encontrarlo empezó a buscar clientes por cuenta propia, logrando juntar una buena cantidad de ellos, ahora trabaja cómodamente desde su casa.
Recurrió a nuestra entidad por la necesidad de adquirir una Computadora para realizar en ella algunos de sus trabajos de contabilidad.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya el crédito otorgado, ya que con eso pudo comprar la herramienta que necesitaba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Miss Mirtha R. J. lives with her parents in the city of Ybycui.  She is a single mother to a little girl and has been an accountant for more than 2 years.  She tells us that it has was very hard to study since she had to travel to another city to do so. 

With a lot of sacrifice and the help of her parents, she was able to finish her studies in 4 years.   After finishing her degree she began to look for a place to work, to be able to cover expenses for herself and her daughter.  After not being able to find anything, she began looking for clients on her own, and has managed to attract quite a few.  She now works comfortably from her home. 

She came to our institution because she needed to buy a computer to be able to complete some of her accounting jobs.  She thanks the Fundacion Paraguaya for the credit they gave her, since she was able to buy the tool that she needed for her work.

loans.use: to buy a computer for public accounting

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah N. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Isaiah has a clinic, which he has had for less than one year.

To help expand his business, Isaiah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more medicine for resale.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Isaiah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Isaiah hopes to expand his clinic business to become bigger than it is.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy N. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is widowed and has five children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Cissy has a boutique shop that sells clothes. She has had her shop for less than one year.  She also has a second business of renting houses.  

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Cissy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Cissy hopes to open another boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet N. is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Juliet has a business of selling timber, which she has had for less than one year.  She also has a second business of renting houses.  

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more timber for resale.  With the help of this loan from BRAC, Juliet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Juliet hopes to buy a vehicle for herself to help her transport the timber.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for resale.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen N. is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has four children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Allen has a small retail shop, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Allen hopes to generate greater profits, buy food and take care of herself.  In the future, Allen hopes to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and soap to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James W. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has five children.  Three of his children are currently in school.  James has a business of a bar, which he has had for less than one year.  He also has a second business of a clinic.  

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sodas and beer for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, James hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, James hopes to expand his business by opening up another branch of the clinic.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas and beer for resale

loans.name: Lugwana

texts.en:
Lugwana S. is 33 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has five children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Lugwana has a small retail shop, which he has had for eight years.  He also has a second business selling phone airtime.  

To help expand his business, Lugwana has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and rice for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Lugwana hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Lugwana hopes to educate his children up to university.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Jean Claude  Alfred

texts.fr:
Client de 49ans marié et père de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie de 08ans à 20ans. En 2009 il ouvre son salon de coiffure homme. 
Avec ce prêt il compte renforcer son stock en achetant des tendeuses, des ventilateurs, des paires de ciseaux, des peignes, poudre, multiples brosses. 
Ses ambitions sont de rendre son salon de coiffure plus spacieux ainsi qu’avoir 2  autre salon de coiffure.
Pour sa famille il compte assurer être capable à scolariser ses enfants ainsi qu’assurer leur vie sociale et leur quotidien.
texts.en:
Jean Claude Alfred B. is 49 years old, married, and the father of five children, aged 8 to 20. In 2009, he opened his hair salon for men. With this loan, he intends to bolster his stock by purchasing clippers, fans, scissors, combs, powders, and several brushes.

He ambitions to make his current salon more spacious, and to open two additional ones. For his family, he wants to be able to send his children to school as well as to ensure their social and daily life.

loans.use: to buy clippers, fans, scissors, combs, powders, and several brushes

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Rajab has a business of a small retail shop, which he has had for three years.         

To help expand his business, Rajab has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar and soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rajab hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Rajab hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en:
S. is 31 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has two children.  Both of his children are currently in school.  Wilberforce has a business selling spare parts, which he has had for eight years.         

To help expand his business, Wilberforce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more spare parts for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Wilberforce hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Wilberforce hopes to build a house of his own.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Lydie  Blanche

texts.fr:
Lydie Blanche est une Cliente de Hope Congo de 40ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie de 3ans à 20ans. Trois (3) de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle est dans la vente des pagnes depuis 2006.
Avec ce prêt elle va renforcer son activité en achetant des  pagnes de multiples qualités telles que des supers wax deluxe, des réal, des hitargets, des super wax.
Ses ambitions sont de réussir de son activité ainsi que devenir indépendant.
texts.en: Lydie Blanche D. M. is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children, aged 3 to 20. Three of her children attend school. Since 2006, she's been selling pagnes (colorful African cloth). With this loan, she will bolster her business by purchasing pagnes in various qualities, such as "super wax deluxe", "real", "hitargets", and "superwax". She ambitions to succeed in her business and to become independent.

loans.use: to buy various qualities of pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Cyr Castelan

texts.fr:
Client de 41ans marié et père de 6 enfants dont l’âge varie de 2ans à 20ans. Il est dans la vente des ustensiles de cuisine depuis 2007.
   Avec ce prêt il compte acheter des poêles, des assiettes porcelaines, des tasses, des marmites.
Son ambition est d’être responsable afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins des autres détaillants en devenant grossiste.
Il veut voir ses enfants réussir dans leurs études et devenir des grands cadres de ce pays.
texts.en: Cyr Castelan K. is 41 years old, married, and the father of six children, aged 2 to 20. He's been selling cooking utensils since 2007. With this loan, he intends to buy frying pans, porcelain plates, cups, and cooking-pots. He ambitions to become a wholesaler responsible for furnishing other retailers. He wants to see his children succeed academically and go on to hold high-ranking positions in his country.

loans.use: to buy frying pans, porcelain plates, cups, and cooking-pots

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la compañía A. de la Ciudad de Caacupé que dista a 5 km de la oficina regional Caacupé.
Con el apoyo financiero que la Fundación Paraguaya les brinda, hoy se sienten seguras por lo que comercialmente realizan, ya que una mala organización implica riesgos económicos y solo se pude sobrellevar con una buena planificación previa.
La presidenta, la Sra. Rosa O. vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica a la peluquería, el crédito que percibe de la fundación lo invierte en su negocio para hacer crecer su actividad y de ese modo aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar al sustento de su hogar.
Como no es la primera vez que están recibiendo un crédito de Kiva, ella sabe que mediante esto puede progresar más, por eso solicita esta ayuda económica nuevamente, a fin de equipar de manera más atractiva su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The women of this committee are from the neighborhood of A. in the city of Caacupé, which is 5 km from the regional office of Caacupé.  

With the financial support of Fundacion Paraguaya, today they feel secure in their businesses, since a bad organization brings economic risks and it's only possible to overcome them by planning ahead well. 

The president, Mrs. Rosa O., lives with her husband and children.  She is a barber.  The loan that she receives from the foundation will be invested in her business to help increase her activity and thereby increase her income and help her to sustain her home.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, facial cleansing products, accessories and hair barrettes, etc.

loans.name: Ingenzi Group

texts.fr:
Innocent N. est motard, et membre du groupe IN..  Il est client d’ACB depuis 2009, ne a Burundi, et il a 36 ans.  Il est marié, et il a un enfant d’un an, et une personne en charge.  Il a fini 6 ans d’école primaire.  Ce prêt est son deuxième cycle avec ACB, et il a bien rembourse ses prêts.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 motos pour son groupe de motards.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de rembourser bien ce crédit, tout en sollicitant beaucoup de crédits en vue de développer son activité.  Il voudrait développer son business, et devenir taxi-man de la voiture.  Pour sa famille, il veut assurer le bien-être de sa famille, et payer des frais d’études pour son enfant.  Son autre activité et la location de sa maison d’habitation.

*Jean Paul N. est present dans la photo, mais pas bien visible
texts.en:
Innocent N. is a motorbike taxi driver and member of the IN. group. He joined ACB in 2009. He is 36 years old and was born in Burundi. He is married with a 1-year-old child, and has another person in his care. He completed six years of primary school.


This is his second loan cycle with ACB, and the previous loan has been fully repaid. He will use this loan to buy two motorcycles for his group. His growth strategy is to repay this loan, and seek additional loans in order to expand his activity. He wants to develop his business and become a motor car taxi driver. He wants to ensure his family’s well-being and pay for his child’s tuition, his other activities, and his rent.


* Jean Paul N. is present in the photo, but barely visible

loans.use: to buy two motorcycles for his group of motorbike taxi drivers

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres  Oñondivepa  se conformó el  20 de agosto del año 2010, mediante  la iniciativa de la Sra. Delis Anatolia B., quien supo del programa y decidió juntar a las señoras de su barrio pues tiene ganas de salir adelante, después de unas cuantas reuniones grupales se juntó a 13 señoras.
Actualmente están en el 2do ciclo del préstamo con mucho esfuerzo y esmero,y lo lograron sólo porque han trabajado en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa "Comité Mujeres Emprendedoras".
La Sra. Delis Anatolia se dedica a la venta de ropas, nos comenta que mediante el  crédito y la asesoría recibida pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su administración. Ella se encontraba vendiendo ropas pero con el dinero que recibió pudo ampliar su negocio y mediante esto la economía de la familia mejoró bastante.
Hoy día solicita el crédito para poder comprar comestibles para su tienda, ya que en Paraguay uno de los negocios con mayor éxito son las tiendas de comestibles, pero sólo si se cuenta con inmensa cantidad de variedades, pues los clientes son exigentes.
Espera poder contar con el apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva y Fundación Paraguaya como en el ciclo anterior.
texts.en:
The Mujeres  Oñondivepa Committees was formed on August 20, 2010, thanks to the initiative of Delis Anatolia B., who decided to bring together the women of her neighborhood to help them get ahead.  After a few meetings and a lot of effort and care, the group garnered 13 women.  It is now on its second loan cycle.  The group works collectively and individually.

Delis Anatolia sells clothes.  She says that because of the credit and advice she has received from the microfinance partner, she has been able to significantly improve her work and her management skills.  She has used the money to increase the size of her business and, as a result, her family's income has increased considerably.
She is asking for the loan to buy groceries for her store, since one of the most successful types of business in Paraguay are grocery stores. They are only successful of they have a wide amount of variety, because the clients are very demanding. She hopes to count on the support of Kiva lenders and Fundacion Paraguaya just as she did in her previous loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food (rice, sugar, herbs, milk products, pastries, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Roddy

texts.fr:
Client de 31 ans, célibataire sans enfant, détenteur d'une licence en économie,toujours au chômage, au lieu de dépendre de ses parents il se lance dans la vente des produits divers DVD et  cassettes Vidéo.
Il ouvre son étalage en 2008 et il achète auprès des grands fournisseurs des vidéos, des DVD et autres produits divers pour son commerce.
A l'obtention de son prêt il va renforcer le stock des ses DVD, les vidéo cassettes, mettre a disposition des clients des produits de tous genres qui vont aussi contribuer a l'élargissement de son étalage. 
Tres entreprenant il a des grandes ambitions ,voyager pour aller a l'étranger  et être un grand importateur des produits divers.
texts.en: The client is 31 years old, single and does not have children.  He holds a degree in economics and is unemployed, but instead of depending on his parents, he sells a variety of DVDs and video cassettes.  He opened his stand in 2008 and buys videos, DVDs and other products from wholesalers to resell at his business.  He is going to use the loan to expand his stock of DVDs and video cassettes to offer his clients choices in all genres which will also contribute to developing his stand.  He is very forward-looking and has big ambitions to travel to foreign countries and to become a large-scale importer of varied products.

loans.use: To purchase DVDs and video cassettes

loans.name: Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
El comité “Juntas Podemos” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque alonso.
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son la preparación y ventas de comidas rápidas.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La señora Maria C. es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la  venta de comidas minutas para su comunidad.
Realiza una actividad de servicio para la zona, es una señora muy creativa y sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos.
Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 4 hijos, y su marido es obrero.
La señora Maria solicita el crédito para la ampliación de su puesto de venta de comidas y para comprar más productos con los cuales preparar las minutas (queso, huevo, leche, etc.)
texts.en:
El comité “Juntas Podemos” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque alonso.
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son la preparación y ventas de comidas rápidas.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La señora Maria C. es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la  venta de comidas minutas para su comunidad.
Realiza una actividad de servicio para la zona, es una señora muy creativa y sus clientes quedan muy satisfechos.
Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 4 hijos, y su marido es obrero.
La señora Maria solicita el crédito para la ampliación de su puesto de venta de comidas y para comprar más productos con los cuales preparar las minutas (queso, huevo, leche, etc.)

The committee "Juntas Podemos" [Together We Can] formed from the union of several neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  The committee members carry out independent economic activities, including preparing and selling fast food.  They are part of a tight-knit group and together are capable of doing activities that strengthen their bond.  

Mrs. Maria C. is one of the members of the committee.  She sells quick meals in her community. She carries out a service for the area, and is a very creative woman with very satisfied customers.  She has a close-knit family with four children, and her husband also works. 

Maria asks for a loan to increase the size of her food stall, and to buy more products which which to prepare the meals (cheese, eggs, milk, etc).

loans.use: to increase the size of a fast food stall and to buy basic ingredients (cheese, milk, eggs, ham, etc)

loans.name: Salmi

texts.es:
La Sra. Salmi tiene 43 años y se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras, esta actividad lo viene realizando desde hace más de 10 años, la compra lo realiza en el mercado de Abasto desde las 4 de la mañana y a las 7 le espera a su hijo en la parada de bus para luego ir a vender los productos en los negocios de su Barrio (Mariano Roque Alonso).
Utilizaría el crédito para poner rejas en su casa pues le falta poco para terminar y luego para la compra de mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras en general.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Salmi is 43 years old.  For more than 10 years, she has been selling fruits and vegetables, which she buys at the Abasto market from 4 am.  At 7 am, she takes her son to the bus stop and then goes to sell her products in the businesses of her neighborhood (Mariano Roque Alonso).

She will use the loan to buy grilles for the house, which is almost finished, as well as to buy a larger amount of fruit and vegetables.  She thanks microfinance partner Fundación Paraguaya for this opportunity.

loans.use: to improve her home and to raise capital to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Niger Armando

texts.es:
Niger soltero, tiene su propio negocio de venta de mariscos desde hace un tiempo, el negocio era de su madre y ahora es de el siendo su mayor ingreso económico. Sus mercaderías son transportadas desde Bluefields siendo producto fresco y de calidad. 
Su objetivo es incrementar sus ventas mediante el ingreso de mayores cantidades de mariscos para ofrecer mayor variedad y cantidad abarcando mayor clientela. Con el préstamo comprara mariscos: camarones, chacalines, pescados entre otros productos.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo como micro empresario.
texts.en:
Niger, who is single, has had his own business selling seafood for some time. It was his mother's business, and now it is his, being his main source of income. His merchandise is transported from Bluefields and is a fresh product of quality.

His goal is to increase his sales through income from higher quantities of seafood so that he can offer more variety and quantity to satisfy most of his customers. With this loan he will purchase seafood such as prawns, shrimp, fish, and other items.

He is grateful to the lenders for this support in developing his small business.

loans.use: to buy seafood, shrimp and fish.

loans.name: Francisco Gabriel

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco B. es soltero, tiene 50 años de edad, es independiente desde muy joven.
El Sr. Francisco es peluquero, se inició luego de cerrar un restaurante que tenía en el este del país. Viajó a Argentina a buscar nuevos horizontes y allí una prima le enseñó el mundo de la belleza en la peluquería y nació en él su verdadera vocación.
Tiene más de 15 años de antigüedad en el ramo, actualmente es jurado de importantes concursos de profesionales y técnicos de la belleza. Posee una clientela formada gracias a su cálida atención y profesionalismo que lo caracterizan.
Solicita el crédito para mejorar las instalaciones de su salón de belleza, adquirir un letrero luminoso y un toldo para mayor publicidad a su microempresa.
texts.en:
Francisco B., 50, is single and has been independent since an early age.

Francisco is a hairdresser.  He started in this trade after he had to close the restaurant he had in the east of Paraguay.  He then traveled to Argentina to seek new opportunities, where a cousin with a salon taught him about the beauty world, and he found his true vocation.

He has been in this business for more than 15 years and has won important professional and technical beauty competitions.  He has an established clientele thanks to the warm attention and professionalism that characterize his service.

He is seeking a loan to improve the fittings in his beauty salon.  He wants to buy fluorescent lettering and an awning to attract more attention to his salon.

loans.use: to buy fluorescent lettering and an awning for his beauty salon

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo tiene 41 años de edad y tiene dos hijos. Viven en casa propia en Morropon, en el departamento de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Se dedica a la venta de carne y granos. Wilfredo es muy conocido en la región y cuenta con una clientela muy establecida. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de granos de menestras. Con esta inversión, espera aumentar sus ventas y lograr mayores ganancias para seguir cuidando a su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Wilfredo posee buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad urbana. Ha tenido otros préstamos y ha cumplido con sus obligaciones en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 41 years old and has two children.  They live in their own home in Morropon, in the department of Piura which is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayaque region. 

He sells meat and seeds.  Wilfredo is well known in the region and has a very well-established clientele.  He wants to increase his business by buying more legume seeds.  With this investment, he hopes to increase his sales and to get a greater profit with which to continue caring for his family.  For this reason, he decided to ask Edpyme Alternatve for a loan of 2000 nuevo soles.  Wilfredo has great personal and professional references from his urban community.  He has had other loans and has met his obligations punctually.

loans.use: to buy more legume seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano es padre de casa de 38 años de edad. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos en casa propia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 2 años, gana su vida como un trabajador en una empresa agrícola en la campiña de la estancia Olmos. Con este trabajo, puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unos arreglos a ella lo que ayudará mejorar la condición de la vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Posee buenas referencias laborales y personales de su comunidad. Es responsable y ha cumplido con sus obligaciones de otros préstamos en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Mariano is a 38 year old father. He lives with his wife and two children in their own home in the District of Olmos, a farming community with considerable business activity. This area is situated in Lambayeque Province, which is more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, he has earned his living as a farm laborer on an estate in Olmos. Through his work he has been able to cover the family expenses. His home is currently in a state of deterioration. Mariano wants to make a few repairs to help his family’s living condition. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN. He has good work-related and personal references from his community. Mariano is responsible and has completed the obligations from his previous loans in a timely manner.

loans.use: To pay for home repairs.

loans.name: Maria Dignidad

texts.es:
Maria tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos a cargo. Vive en casa propia la cual está ubicada en un caserío pequeño rural que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria, a unos 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Las actividades principales en dicho caserío son la agricultura, crianza de animales de engorde y comercio.

Maria posee una pequeña bodega en la cual vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años en su domicilio. Vende sus productos al contado y al crédito. También se dedica al engorde de aves de corral, cerdos y otros animales, los cuales luego comercializa. Ya ha ganado un gran número de clientes por su experiencia y variedad de productos.

Maria desea usar su crédito para surtirse la bodega de productos por la campaña escolar. Espera proveer sus clientes con los productos que han pedido y así generar mayores ingresos en esta temporada. Desea usar sus ingresos en gastos de educación para sus propios hijos. Para lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old, married, and has two dependent children. She lives in her own home in a small rural village in the District of La Victoria, which is approximately thirty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. The main activities in this village are agriculture, raising animals for fattening, and trade.

Maria has a small store where she sells groceries and basic necessities. She has managed this business from her home for more than ten years. Maria sells her products for cash or on credit. She also fattens poultry, pigs, and other animals for eventual resale. Maria has accumulated a large number of customers as a result of her experience and offering a variety of products.

Maria wants to use her loan to stock her store with products for the school year. She hopes to provide her customers with the merchandise they have requested so that she can generate more income this season. Maria wants to use her earnings to pay for the educational expenses of her own children. To accomplish this goal, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is a farmer from Vodyanoye, where he lives with his wife, 11-year-old daughter and son. Yuryi grows different vegetables in his 6 greenhouses. Moreover, he has a separate greenhouse for seedlings. Every year Yuryi plants 10,000 tomatoes. He has invested about 180,000 UAH in his venture, which he has been operating for 10 years. 

Yuryi is requesting a loan of 15,000 UAH to install a heating system for 3 greenhouses. He is hoping to buy a gas boiler and hose pipes for this purpose. More consistent temperatures will help him grow timely harvests and receive a steady income. This business is the main source of income for the family.

loans.use: to install a heating system for three greenhouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for home repairs.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
Jose tiene 41 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Vive en casa propia con su familia en la ciudad de Morropon en el departamento de Piura, a más de cuarto horas de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Gana su vida dedicándose a la crianza y venta de animales. Cría los animales menores y cuando han alcanzado un buen tamaño y edad, los vende en el mercado local. Es muy conocido en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de más animales menores y de alimento balanceado. Espera criar más animales para poder generar mayores ganancias que ayudarán solventar sus gastos familiares. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Jose es muy responsable y trabajador. Ha tenido otros préstamos y ha cumplido con sus obligaciones en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Jose is 41 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in his own home with his family in the city Morrropon in the Department of Piura, which is more than four hours away from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Jose earns his livelihood by raising and selling animals. The animals are bred and kept until they reach the proper size and age. Afterwards they are sold at the local market. Jose is well-known in the area and has an established customer base. He wants to invest this loan in the purchase of additional small animals and balanced feed. Jose hopes to raise more animals so that he can generate more income to help cover his family’s expenses. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

Jose is very responsible and a hard worker. He has taken other loans and completed his obligations in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase animals and balanced nutritional feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is married and has a son and 2 daughters. He grows early vegetables, tomatoes, and radishes and owns a vineyard. Gennadyi has 9 constructed greenhouses. He has already invested 200,000 UAH in his enterprise, which he has operated for 12 years. His annual expenses on seeds and plastic film amount to 25,000 UAH.   

Gennadyi is seeking a 15,000 UAH loan to reconstruct his greenhouses into vineries (greenhouses for growing vines). He is planning to buy plastic film and fertilizers to refurbish the greenhouses, making them higher and more spacious, and to plant 800 vines. There are few vinedressers in the region. Gennadyi is hoping to continue investing in this business since vine prices remain high during the whole season, thereby generating additional income.

loans.use: to refurbish his greenhouses for growing vines

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 64 años y vive con su esposa en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en la parte urbana del distrito de Olmos, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Desde hace cuatro años, se dedica a la carpintería. Repara y elabora artículos de madera como camas, roperos, adornos, etc. Es muy conocido en su región y cuenta con una clientela muy establecida. Desea usar su crédito para comprar un pequeño moto para una mesa trifásica la cual usa para cortar madera. Con este dispositivo, podrá aumentar el número de productos que elabora semanalmente. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Antonio is 64 years old and lives with his wife in their own home located in the urban section of the District of Olmos, which is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Antonio has worked in carpentry for four years. He repairs and manufactures items made of wood such as beds, wardrobes, decorations, and other products. Antonio is well-known in the region and has an established customer base. He wants to use this loan to buy a small motor for a sawing table that he uses for cutting wood. With this device, he will be able to increase the number of products made on a weekly basis. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To purchase a small motor for a sawing table.

loans.name: Jhony

texts.es: El señor Jhony es mecánico y vende accesorios para movilidad; el crédito lo requiere para comprar un vehiculo que utilizará para trabajar y su esposa es comerciante, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen. Vive en casa  de un familiar pero pagan alquiler; la casa queda ubicada en la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene dos hijos . Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Sr. Jhony is a mechanic and sells automobile accessories. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a vehicle for work. His wife is a merchant. With the income they earn, they are able to support themselves. Jhony lives in the home of a relative and pays rent. The house is located in the District of Las Lomas in the city of La Paz. He is married and has two children.

This is the first time he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle to use for work.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario V. O. tiene 43 años y vive en el Corregimiento la Playa muy cerca al mar,  con sus  4 hijos en las edades de 12 a 18 años y con su esposa,  con la cual desarrolla el negocio de vender  almuerzos y de productos naturales mediante catálogos, como Mario es un hombre trabajador que es conciente de las oportunidades de ingresos, también    presta  servicios de transporte  a la   Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que lo apoyó para lograr la compra de su vehículo. El negocio de comidas lo inició hace dos años y el de comercialización de productos naturales hace uno, esto lo planeó para que su esposa lo apoyara en la generación de ingreso pues quiere que sus cuatro hijos tengan condiciones de bienestar y con ello se formen profesionalmente en el futuro, por eso se esmera en la  construcción del presente mediante su trabajo.
Este es su octavo financiamiento con él comprará víveres como aceite, arroz, harina, y verduras, para preparar los   y también invertirá  en productos naturales, de bajo costo; Su meta es tener su casa propia en el proyecto Villas de San Pablo y aumentar sus ingresos en términos de vender mas de lo que hasta ahora ha logrado, y él ha solicitando su credikiva para obtener una rentabilidad del 40% toda vez que invierta en lo que tiene planeado oportunamente.
texts.en:
Mario V. O. is 43 years old and a resident of Corregimiento La Playa, which is very close to the sea. He lives with his four children, who range in age from 12 to 18 years, and his wife with whom he developed a business selling lunches and another one selling natural products through catalogs. Mario is a hardworking gentleman who is conscious of income-generating opportunities. He also provides transportation services to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, the organization that helped him buy his vehicle. Mario started his food business two years ago and his natural products business one year ago. He plans to help his wife generate an income because they want their four children to have conditions that promote their well-being and help them become professionals in the future. For this reason, he takes great care with the businesses he has built.

Mario is receiving his eighth loan and will use the funds to buy supplies such as oil, rice, flour, and vegetables for preparing meals. He will also invest in natural products at low cost. His goals include having a house in the subdivision of Villas de San Pablo and increasing his income by generating more sales than he has done previously. He is requesting this Kiva loan so that he can achieve profitability of 40% and invest in the opportunities that he has planned.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for preparing meals as well as low-cost natural products for his second business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos. Viven en el caserío de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. El caserio es mediano pero tiene aspiraciones a superarse.

Desde hace más de 14 años, se dedica a la venta de comida y bebida lo cual realiza en una parte de su domicilio. Es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de más envases de cervezas, mesas y sillas para su local. Espera poder atender a más clientes, y adquirir una mayor utilidad para solventar sus gastos familiares. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 46 years old, single, and has two children. She lives in the village of Tambogrande, a farming area that lies in the province and region of Piura, which is more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region. This village is of average size, but has aspirations for growth.

Beatriz has been serving food and beverages from a section of her home for more than fourteen years. She is well-known in the area and has an established customer base. Beatriz wants to invest her loan in more bottles of beer, tables, and chairs for her establishment. She hopes to serve more customers and acquire more income to cover the family expenses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN.

loans.use: To purchase bottles of beer, tables, and chairs for her establishment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, pasta, and grains in order to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Las Mujeres Para El Desarrollo De Villa Madrid Group

texts.es:
El comité “Las mujeres para el desarrollo D. Villa Madrid” se formó con la unión D. varias vecinas D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso.
Las integrantes son muy unidas y cuentan con personas guías con gran potencial D. liderazgo que las ayudan a seguir adelante, así también tienen integrantes muy humildes pero con ganas D. crecer como personas y como equipo aún sabiendo que la convivencia es difícil.
La sra. Gladys C. es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia y sacrificada, ella posee un pequeño negocio, una tienda donD. venD. desD. frutas y verduras hasta materiales D. limpieza del hogar. Abrió su pequeña tienda general decidida a conseguir mayores ingresos familiares, pues comenta que antes D. poder poseer el negocio, pasaron días en que no tenía ni para alimentarse ella misma, por eso procura progresar para que ninguno D. sus hijos pase por lo mismo, para que no sufran, y que por el contrario, puedan estudiar y ganar un salario digno que les facilite la vida.
Ella desea poder conseguir el crédito para prosperar tanto ella como su familia.
texts.en:
The “Las mujeres para el desarrollo D. Villa Madrid” (Women for the Development of Villa Madrid) village bank started when a number of neighborhood women came together in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.
It's a tight-knit group, with some members who are strong leaders who help the others move forward, and some who are more timid but who want to grow as people and as a team, even though it can be challenging.
Mrs. Gladys C. is very dedicated to her family and makes a lot of sacrifices for them. She has a small business selling everything from fruits and vegetables to household cleaning products. She decided to open her small store to increase her income for her family. Before opening the store, days would go by when she didn't even have enough food to feed herself. It is for this reason that she wants to progress, so that none of her children have to suffer, can study, and make a decent salary. She'd like to receive this loan so she and her family can prosper.

loans.use: Ampliamiento de sus negocios o tiendas generales.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La  señora Maria es comerciante, ella vende ropa; el crédito lo requiere para comprar ropa de niños como ser deportivos, ya que le hace falta este tipo de prendas de vestir en su stock de mercadería. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir los gastos de su familia. La señora es separada y tiene dos hijos  vive en casa propia la cual queda ubicada en la zona de Alto Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz, es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en nuestra institución.
texts.en: Maria sells clothing for a living, and will use this loan to buy children's clothing. For example, she has no athletic clothing and would like to add that type of clothing to her stock. She uses the income from her business to cover her family's expenses. She is separated from her husband and has two children. She lives in her own home in the Alto Pampahasi neighborhood of La Paz. This is the first time she's applied for a loan from our institution.

loans.use: to buy children's track suits, which are in great demand among her customers.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 25 años es un joven responsable. Su familia lo conforma su esposa Magaly y su hijo Erick, a quien ama mucho. Juntos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Palca. Desde que tenía 18 años se dedicó a la agricultura, en todo este corto tiempo pudo ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar hace poco un terreno agrícola, pues antes solo alquilaba chacras anualmente. Sus principales cultivos constan de arveja y papa, los cuales cuida constantemente todas las mañanas. La mayor dificultad que tiene es la falta de capital de trabajo, ya que necesita de una suma considerable de dinero para poder comenzar una gran siembra. Ahora él está seguro de poder ahorrar en mayor cantidad, ya que dio el primer paso para poder emprender sus objetivos de sembrar en mayores cantidades. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Palqueños en acción”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera realizar sus objetivos. Carlos, hace poco compró un terreno agrícola, por ello con el crédito está pensando invertir en la compra de semillas de arveja, y varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 25, is a responsible young man. His family consists of his wife Magaly and his son Erick who he loves very much. They live together in a rented house in the town of Palca. Carlos has been farming since he was 18 years old. During this short period of time, he was able to save enough money to buy a small plot of farmland. Previously he had to rent land on an annual basis. His main crops are peas and potatoes, which he cares for constantly every morning. His greatest difficulty is the lack of operating capital. Carlos needs a considerable amount of money to start planting a large crop. Now he is confident that he will be able to save more than he did previously in order to meet his target of a larger harvest.

Carlos is a member of the Communal Bank “Palqueños en Acción”. This is his first loan with MFP and he hopes that his group can accomplish its objectives. Now that he has bought a piece of land, Carlos will use this loan to invest in the purchase of pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of organic fertilizer and seeds for planting peas.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan Pablo es técnico en ensamblaje de computadoras, el crédito lo necesita para comprar una Pc ya que son herramientas de trabajo que utiliza para realizar con mayor eficiencia su trabajo. Vive  en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero  no tiene  hijos. El  señor esta satisfecho y muy contento con los préstamos que se le otorgaron, pues es cliente nuestro desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Pablo is a computer assembly technician. He needs a loan to buy a personal computer for work so that he can perform his job more efficiently. Juan Pablo lives in the home of his parents located in the District of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

Sr. Juan Pablo is happy and content with the loans that have been provided. He has been a client of IMPRO since 2007.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for work.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
