Con su tienda de víveres y el comercio de productos agrícolas Néstor C. O. de 47 años, ha logrado sostener su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 11 a 23 años. Él inició como emprendedor de productos agrícolas, para generar ingresos pues no encontraba trabajo, así pasaba de ciudad en ciudad llevando yuca, ñame aguacate y maíz, luego con la ayuda de su esposa pusieron una tienda en una casa arrendada pero gradualmente con sus esfuerzos y sus ahorros lograron tener la suya propia, bien adecuada y con local para sus negocios.
Este es el séptimo financiamiento que recibe Néstor de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha logrado crecer como empresario de la microempresa y adquirir más bienestar. En su negocio maneja una rentabilidad del 9% y con su credikiva espera comprar víveres para la tienda y maíz al por mayor, a esto último dedicará la mayor parte del crédito por ser un producto de temporada que rota rápidamente y deja buenas utilidades.
texts.en:
Nestor C. O., age 47, is trader of agricultural products and also manages a grocery store. These activities enable him to support his family, which consists of his wife and three children who range in age from 11 to 23. He started out as an entrepreneur of agricultural products to generate income because he was not able to find work. Nestor traveled from city to city selling cassava, yams, avocados, and corn. His wife helped out by managing a store they established in a rented home. Through their efforts and the savings they accumulated over time, Nestor and his family now have a house of their own that is well-equipped and has adequate space for their businesses.

This is the seventh loan he has received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization that help entrepreneurs grow their micro-businesses and improve their well-being. In his business, Nestor maintains a profitability of 9%. He will use his Kiva loan to buy groceries for his store and corn in bulk. Most of the loan will be used to buy corn since it is a seasonal product that has quick turnover and results in good profits.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and corn in bulk.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoraida; la socia tiene 27 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio de compra y venta de leña y carrizo ella vende por arrobas a sus clientes que le solicitan a la vez la socia tiene su tienda de abarrotes  el cual ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de querer seguir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como carrizo y leña y  para aumentar la mercaderia para su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Zoraida is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” which is located in the District of San Jeronimo, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Zoraida has a business buying and selling firewood and reeds. She sells in bundles by weight according to how much her customers order. Zoraida also has a grocery store where she sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, and milk. She is a cheerful person who wants to succeed on behalf of her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy reeds, firewood, and more merchandise for her grocery store.

Zoraida is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store as well as firewood and reeds.

loans.name: Tabethsu Finoh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), Kiva's partners in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Tabethsu Finoh” group. They are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Malikie S. is the leader of this group. Makikie is 33 years old and married, with 3 children who attend primary school. Malikie has been operating a business selling cigarettes, toothpaste, toothbrushes, sardines, and other items for five years. With the help of this loan, Malikie will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, toothpaste, toothbrushes, sardines, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Roman

texts.es: Román, de 40 años. Es un hombre feliz, pues tiene una familia unida, que lo conforman su esposa Delia y sus 5 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 3 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Pichanaki (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica es la siembra de plátano en su variedad de isla y bellaco, los cuales cultiva en sus terrenos agrícolas ubicados en Puente las palmas. Durante sus 3 años de experiencia, pudo obtener buenos cultivos, los cuales enseñó a su hijo quien le ayuda en las jornadas de trabajo. Paralelo a este trabajo, Román; también se dedica al podado de los naranjos y cafetales, en otros terrenos agrícolas donde obtiene un dinero extra. Los principales problemas que enfrenta son las constantes lluvias que existen en esta temporada, pues no permite que madure el fruto y por ende no le genera ganancias. Sus planes son incursionar en la siembra de cacao, pues el precio del producto en el mercado es muy bueno. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Gedeón de los olivos”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan. Román, comprará con el crédito solicitado, 5 bolsas de abono orgánico que oscilan entre S/. 200 cada uno, los cuales esparcirá entre sus cultivos de plátanos, de esa manera poder prevenir la gusanera que aqueja sus sembríos en esto tiempos.
texts.en:
Román, age 40, is a happy man with a close family that consists of his wife Delia and his five children. Only three of his children live with him in his house located in the city of Pichanaki, which is in the central Peruvian jungle. Román works by growing bananas of the “Isla” and “Bellaco” varieties on his farmland located in Puente Las Palmas. He has gained three years of experience and achieved good crops. Román teaches his son who helps him during the work day. In addition to growing his own crops, Román also trims orange trees and coffee plants on other farms to earn extra money. The main challenge he faces is the constant precipitation that takes place during the rainy season, which prevents his fruit from ripening and reduces his earnings. His plans include planting cacao because it generates a very good price at the market.

Román is a member of the Communal Bank “Gedeón de Los Olivos” (Gideon of the Olive Trees). This is his first loan with MFP and he is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided. Román will use the loan he requested to purchase five sacks of organic fertilizer that cost 200 PEN each. He will apply the fertilizer on his banana crops to prevent maggots from causing damage.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariluz; la socia tiene 29 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica  al negocio de artesanía ella elabora aretes de todo tipo de tamaño,color,forma entre otros, la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria y a pedido aun no cuenta con un stand donde pueda exponer su trabajo pero espera más adelante aperturar su propio stand, a la vez la socia trabaja en un hostal por el centro de la ciudad ella trabaja de lunes a sábado por las mañanas ,la socia es una persona alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de material para elaborar sus aretes y así poder tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Mariluz is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” which is located in the District of San Jeronimo, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Mariluz has a craft business in which she makes earrings of all sizes, colors, and shapes. She works as a traveling vendor and takes orders since she does not have a stand where she can display her creations. However, she wants to open her own stand in the future. In the meantime, she works at a hostel in the central part of the city Monday through Saturday in the mornings. She is a cheerful person who is very eager to succeed. Her loan will be used to buy materials for making earrings so that she can offer more variety to her customers.

Mariluz is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making earrings.

loans.name: Beug Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BEUG FALLOU est créé le 03 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois De B.

Madame Aissatou N. (la seule femme debout sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de légumes. Elle s'approvisionne en demi gros et revend dans le village. Elle fait aussi de l'embouche bovine. Elle est bien expérimentée dans ces domaines d'activité pour les avoir pratiquées depuis plus de cinq ans. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de mieux développer son activité afin de gagner plus de revenus.

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group BEUG FALLOU was founded on December 3, 2007.  It is made up of 15 women from the same village.  They organized themselves by their neighborhoods and similarities.  The group is a part of the Banc Villageois of B..

Mrs. Aissatou N. (the woman standing in the photograph) is the leader of the group. She is married and mother of two children for whom she is responsible.

She has a small business selling vegetables.  She buys stock from a distributor and then resells in her village.  She also grazes cattle.  She has a lot of experience in these businesses as she has worked in them for over five years.

The new loan will allow her to grow the business in order to increase revenues. Her goal is to meet her needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to grow and promote her business

loans.name: Carmen Eusebia

texts.es:
L a socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Carmen; La socia tiene 65 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos, de (42,34) años de edad; la socia tiene un lubricentro y en este prestan servicios de lavados de auots y engrase, la socia tiene el apoyo de sus hijos y esposo en cuanto a la administración y manejo de su negocio, la socia trabaja dentro de este banco comunal desde hace 10 años y es un banco trabajador, disciplinado y muy bien organizado, el grupo que rodea a la socia son personas muy amables y llenas de vida, alegres y les gusta reunirse en cada cita que tiene en el local de Arariwa; La socia invertirá el crédito en la compra de aceites, lubricantes, detergentes, grasas entre otros; La socia solicita el crédito para comprar algunos productos para el negocio.
La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank “Amauta” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 65 years old, married, and has two children (ages 42 and 34). Carmen has a business in which she provides car wash and oil change services. She has the assistance of her children and husband in managing her business. Carmen has been a member of this Communal Bank for ten years and the group is known for being hardworking, disciplined, and well-organized. The members are friendly individuals who are happy and full of life. They enjoy getting together for each of their meetings at the local Arariwa office.

Carmen will invest her loan in the purchase of oil, lubricants, detergents, grease, and other supplies. The money she is requesting will be used to buy these products for her business. Carmen is happy with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her car wash and oil change business.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jeronimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; la socia tiene 52 años de edad, viuda y tiene 9 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio de venta de comida ella vende en el mercado de Chimpahuaylla y en la plazoleta de ahí mismo, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en esta actividad del cual se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como arroz, aceite, menestras, carnes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Señor de Los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” which is located in the District of San Jeronimo, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 52 years old and a widow with nine children. Hilda sells food at the Chimpahuaylla Market and in the market square. She sells as a traveling vendor to all of her customers who ask for her food. Hilda enjoys working and feels happy that her business helps her family move forward. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies for her business such as rice, oil, vegetables, and meats according to what she needs.

Hilda is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase rice, oil, vegetables, and meats.

loans.name: Ko'eju Group

texts.es:
El comité “Ko'eju” se formó con la unión D. varias vecinas D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso.
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades teniendo que soportar las altas temperaturas.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz D. realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La Señora Maria tuvo que optar y dedicarse a la venta D. bebidas desD. su casa para así poder cuidar a su madre enferma que depenD. totalmente D. ella. Necesita D. este crédito para poder obtener mayor cantidad D. bebidas para ofertar a sus clientes mayor variedad.
texts.en:
The “Ko’eju” Committee was formed as a result of several neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso joining together. All of the members have developed business activities that can thrive in warm temperatures. As a group, the members are very close and capable of conducting joint activities that strengthen their friendships.

Sra. Maria chose to sell beverages from her home because she also needs to take care of her mother who is ill and totally dependent on her. She needs this loan to acquire a large quantity of beverages so that she offer her customers a wider variety.

loans.use: To purchase beverages (sodas, energy drinks, wine, beer, and other drinks).

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marleni; la socia tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio de tienda de abarrotes ella vende productos de primera necesidad entre otros mas, a la vez la socia también se dedica a la venta de ladrillos y tejas materiales de construcción ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, la socia está feliz ya que mediante estos negocios que ella tiene puede sacar a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su tienda de abarrotes arroz, azúcar, leche, huevos, golosinas, gaseosas entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla" community bank, located in San Jerónimo district in the province and department of Cusco.

Marleni is 42 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a grocery store that sells basic goods and home products. She also sells bricks and produces construction materials together with her husband. Marleni is happy with her work because through her businesses she is able to take provide for her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy products for her grocery store, such as rice, sugar, milk, eggs, candy, and soda, among other things. Marleni is happy to have this loan opportunity and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for grocery store, including rice, sugar, milk, eggs, candy, soda, etc.

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMAUTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Estela; La socia tiene 62 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 5 hijos, (todos ellos independientes); la socia es docente de profesión, la socia es una de las fundadoras del banco comunal, la socia trabaja desde hace 10 años con esta modalidad y le ha ido muy bien, en especial la socia nos comenta que a ella en particular le gusta reunirse con sus amigas cada mes; La socia trabaja vendiendo útiles escolares a pedido ella tiene a sus nietos en el colegio y tiene amistades que son las mamás de los amigos de sus nietos y otras personas que la conocen y le hacen pedidos y ella les provee todo lo relacionado con la época escolar. La socia también compra y vende productos de belleza por catálogos y le va bien, ella en esta oportunidad desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de útiles escolares y aumentar a sus productos de belleza.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "AMAUTA" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

Mrs. Estela is 62 years old, married and has five children who all live independently.  She is a teacher and one of the founders of the communal bank, with which she has been working for 10 years.  She enjoys it and especially likes the monthly meetings with her friends.

Estela sells school supplies on an order basis.  She has school-aged grandchildren and friends with grandchildren and other people who place orders for  everything related to school activity.  She also buys and sells beauty products by catalogue and the business is going well for her.  She plans to use this loan to buy school supplies and increase her beauty products inventory.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies and beauty products for retail

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU est créé le 03 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 14 femmes vivant toutes dans le même village. Elles se sont regroupées par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de B.

Madame Mame N. (la seule femme debout sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait de l'élevage de mouton. Elle possède d'un petit troupeau de 12 moutons. Avec son nouveau crédit de 160.000 francs CFA elle va augmenter le nombre de têtes de moutons. Elle attend les grandes fêtes religieuses pour vendre les plus gras moutons.

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU was founded on December 3, 2007.  It is made up of 14 women who live in the same village.  They organized themselves by neighborhood and similarities. The group is a part of the Banc Villageois of B..

Mrs. Mame N. (the woman standing in the photograph) is the leader of the group. She is 37 years old.  She is married and the mother of two children.

She rears sheep. She has a small herd of 12 sheep. With the loan of 160,00 CFA francs, she is going to increase the number of sheep in the herd.  She is waiting for the big religious holidays to sell the fattest sheep. 

Her goal is to contribute financially to the needs of her family and also increase her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to increase her herd of sheep

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar Eduardo C. T. tiene 29 años de edad y fabrica artesanías propias de su naturaleza cultural el teje hamacas y bolsos en los diferentes modelos que quiere el cliente que ve en las revistas y que el mismo apropia para enriquecer su mercadeo. Edgar, como artesano de tradición familiar se inicia en el negocio desde el año 2004 cuando realizó sus estudios como administrador  de empresas agropecuarias, pero no encontró empleo y decidió acudir a su potencial y a su aptitud para el emprendimiento y las artesanías.
Él ha recibido  dos créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, incluyendo  su credikiva   con el comprará materias primas para hacer hamacas y bolsos, inversión que pronostica ser  exitosa porque esta basada en pedidos de su clientes, esta es importante para Edgar porque cuando no tiene productos fabricados en su taller, por su muy bajo capital, el  debe responder  a  las solicitudes de sus compradores comprando   a un mayor precio y se   disminuyen sus utilidades. 
Desde que recibió su primer crédito con la Fundación el ha logrado aumentar sus ganancias y con ellas compró una maquina para elaborar bolsos; antes de recibir este apoyo para lograr capitalizarse   acudía a sus familiares y estos le ayudaban prestándole el dinero, ahora es un poco mas autónomo respecto a los que en ese momento le tendieron su mano.
Edgar vive en San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de Bolívar, con su esposa que también es artesana y es su mayor apoyo, con ella construye su sueño de tener un gran almacén en la carretera troncal del occidente, donde se encuentra  ubicado el sector artesanal de este municipio.
texts.en:
Edgar Eduardo C. T. is 29 years old and makes his own traditional handicrafts.  He weaves hammocks and bags in different styles based on what customers see in magazines which he also uses for marketing purposes.  Based on family tradition, Edgar began his business in 2004 when he studied agricultural business administration.  He was unable to find a job and decided to use his entrepreneurial and artistic skills and aptitude.

He has received two loans through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, including his crediKiva, which he will use to purchase materials to make hammocks and bags.  The investment is bound to be successful because already has taken orders from customers.  Because of his lack of capital, Edgar usually does not keep an inventory of products so he must supply orders by paying a higher price for materials which means less profit.

Since receiving his first loan through the Foundation he has been able to increase his earnings and buy a machine to make the bags.  Before he was able to do this he had to go to family members for capital.  Now he is more independent.

Edgar lives in San Jacinto, in the department of Bolivar.  His wife is also an artisan and she is his greatest support.  Together they are building their dream of having a large shop along the main road west of town where the crafts sector is located.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make hammocks and bags

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucia; la socia tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; la socia trabaja en un hostal por el centro de la ciudad ella trabaja de lunes a sábado su día libre puede variar en la semana, la socia está feliz ya que mediante este trabajo pudo ahorrar algo de capital para poder aperturar algún tipo de negocio como una tienda de abarrotes o crianza de animales menores cuyes y gallinas aun no está segura cual de los dos negocios pondrá, la socia es una persona perseverante y responsable y todo sus proyectos lo hace en función a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para iniciar un negocio propio y dejar de trabajar para otros y ser su propio jefe.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA" communal bank which is located in the district of San Jerónimo, in the province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Lucia is 34 years old and has a live-in partner and son.  She works in a hostal in the city center from Monday through Saturday, with one day off a week which varies.  She is happy that because of her job she can save enough money to open her own business, which will be either a grocery store or raising her own animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She still hasn't decided which of the two she will pursue but she is persevering and responsible, taking into account her family for all her projects.

Lucia is planning to use the loan to set up her own business and be her own boss.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To set up her own business and be her own boss

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Jerónimo,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hilda; la socia tiene 42 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros mas, a la vez la socia es profesora del nivel primario ella trabaja en el colegio nacional del distrito de San Jerónimo, la socia está contenta ya que mediante su trabajo ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos de belleza y así tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA" communal bank which is located in the district of San Jerónimo in the province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Hilda is 42 years old, married and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with the sale of beauty products such as creams, perfumes and cologne, among other things.  She is also a primary school teacher and works in the national school in the San Jerónimo District.  She is pleased because her job helps her family get ahead.

She plans to use the loan to purchase more beauty products to offer a wider variety to customers.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products to offer a wider variety to customers

loans.name: Sope Serigne Bara Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE BARA est créé le 15 août 2010, trois ans après l'inauguration  du Banc Villageois le 03 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de B.

Madame DIARRA F. (la seule femme debout sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de pagnes tissés. Elle s'approvisionne à la capitale (Dakar) pour revendre dans le marché hebdomadaire qui se tient tous les lundis dans son village. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement afin d'accroitre ses revenus financiers

Les bénéfices générés par son petit commerce lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et à développer un petit élevage de volailles à domicile
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Serigne Bara was created on 15 august 2010, three years after the founging of the B. Banc Villageois. The group is made up of 13 womens who are all from the same village. They came together out of friendship and neighborliness.

Madame Diarra F. (the only woman standing up in the photo) is the president of the group. She is 28 years old. She is married and the monther of 4 children she cares for.

She sells handwoven fabric. She purchases her wares in the capital (Dakar) to resell them in the weekly market which happens each Monday in her village.

Her new loan will allow her to purchase more sstock in order to generate more revenues.

The profits generated by her business allowe her to contribute to her family's expenses and to start raising chickens in her yard.

loans.use: To buy a half-dozen handwoven bolts of fabric  and pay the transport costs associated with her business

loans.name: Littman

texts.es: Littman, de 31 años, es un hombre que trabaja para cuidar de su esposa Cleofe y sus 2 hijos: Sumer y Junior. Con los cuales vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sangani (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica es el trasporte público, cubriendo las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Ya tiene 3 años dedicándose a ello, y según menciona antes trabajaba con el motocarro de su mamá, con el tiempo y esfuerzo, pudo obtener su propio vehículo con el que obtiene mayores ganancias. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es su independencia, más le desagrada cuando se malogra el motocarro, ya que pierde dinero y tiempo arreglándola. Asimismo su esposa Cleofe, tiene una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, ayudando así a los gastos del hogar. Ya que la principal dificultad que tienen son los costos para la educación y alimentación de los primero hijos que tiene su esposa con su anterior compromiso. “Cuando se trabaja con ahínco, se puede obtener buenas ganancias”, afirma. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Gedeón de los olivos”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz por el apoyo constante que recibe de parte de su asociación. Littman, como cada año, con el crédito está pensando renovar el motor de su motocarro, la tarjeta de circulación y demás papeles que le pide el estado para que pueda transitar. Asimismo con el resto del dinero, abastecerá la tienda de comestibles de su esposa.
texts.en:
Littman is 31 years old and works hard to support his wife, Cleofe, and his two children, Sumer and Junior.  They live in their own home which is located in Sangani in the Peruvian central forest.  He works in public transportation in the different streets of the town of Pichanaki.  He has been doing this for three years.  He used to work with his mother's motorcycle but over time, with hard work, he was able to buy his own vehicle and now has a higher income.

What he likes about his job is that it is independent.  One of the drawbacks, however, is that when the motorcyle is out of order he spends time getting it repaired and loses money.

His wife, Cleofe, has a grocery store and sells basic needs items, so she also helps cover houshold expenses.  The main difficulties they have are paying for education and food for the children his wife has from a previous relationship.

"When you work hard you can make a good profit.", he says.  He is a member of the "Gedeón de los olivos" communal bank and this is his third loan through MFP.  He is satisfied with the constant support he receives from the association.  Littman plans to use the loan to purchase a new motorcycle engine and renew his driver's licence.  He plans to use the rest of the loan to buy supplies for his wife's grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle engine, renew his driver's licence and buy grocery store supplies

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara Maria R. P., vive en  Cartagena, ciudad ubicada en el departamento de Bolívar, allí tiene un negocio de servicios  de internet, telecomunicaciones  y dulcería en general;  Clara es una mujer muy dedicada a su vida familiar que siempre ha logrado apoyar a sus  3 hijos que ahora están en  las edades de 20 a 26 años. cona llamadas locales, nacionales e internacionales y finalmente adicionó el internet, como una herramienta para que todos en su comunidad estuvieran comunicados, mientras ella recibía un ingreso por ofrecer servicios necesaioros a sus clientes. Clara es una mujer que reconoce el gran apoyo institucional por eso expresa que “gracias al apoyo de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, nuestro negocio ha crecido brindándole un mejor servicio a sus clientes.” Su sueño es convertirlo en un centro de comunicaciones muy competitivo que cada día este actualizado con  los avances tecnológicos y es que esto es justamente lo que ella llama un gran desafío.
Su credikiva que es su tercer financiamiento con la Fundación lo invertirá en tres partes: con la primera   comprará equipos de computo, con la segunda  invertirá en el arreglo de los equipos en mal estado  y con la tercera parte del crédito hará mantenimiento locativo, para  continuar ofreciendo un servicio de excelencia en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Clara Maria R. P. lives in Cartagena, a city located in the departament of Bolíva. She has a business there offering internet service, telecommunications and general sweets. Clara is a woman who is very dedicated to her family life. She has always been able to support her 3 children who are 20 and 26 years old. She offered local, national and international calls, and then finally she added internet as tools for everyone in her community to stay in touch, while she received income for offering these necessary services to her customers. Clara is a woman who acknowledges the great institutional support she has received and for that she says "thanks to the support from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, our business has grown, offering a better service to the customers." Her dream is to convert it into a very competitive communication center that is always up to date with technological advances and that it just what she calls a big challenge. 

Her Kiva loan, which is her third loan from the Fundación, will be invested in three things:  first, she will buy computers. Second, she will invest in repairing the computers that are in porr condition and third, she will invest in maintenance of the locale, in order to keep offering an excellent service in hr community.

loans.use: to invest in three things. First she will buy computers. Second, she will invest in repairs, and third, she will do maintenance on the locale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 23 años; es una mujer trabajadora. Vive junto a su esposo José y su hijo Daniel, de 6 años. En una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Tapo. Desde joven comenzó a trabajar en la agricultura, de eso ya 7 años. En todo este tiempo pudo aprender las técnicas de cultivo como también los conocimientos para poder progresar y salir adelante. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, arveja y habas, los cuales siembra en terrenos alquilados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder compartir con su esposo las ganas de salir adelante, pues juntos salen a trabajar todos los días. Más le dificulta obtener su propio capital de trabajo, por los gastos que realiza en el alquiler anual de sus terrenos y los estudios de su hijo. Muy pronto cosechará 25 sacos de papa y 15 sacos de habas, con los que obtendrá una buena ganancia, y así incrementar sus ahorros con los que piensa muy pronto comprar su propio terreno. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “San jerónimo de Queta”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada, pues el apoyo que recibe de su asociación le ayuda en la mejora de sus cultivos. Nelly, dentro de estos meses cosechará papa, por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de papa, los cuales esparcirá en sus terrenos agrícolas, después de su cosecha.
texts.en:
Nelly is 23 years old and a hard-working woman.  She lives together with her husband José and her 6 year-old son Daniel, in a rental house, in the town of Tapo.  Nelly has been farming since she was young.  She started 7 years ago.  Over the years she has learned farming techniques and also the knowledge needed in order to be able to make progress and get ahead.  Her main crops are potatoes, peas and beans which she grows on rented land.  What Nelly most likes about her work is being able to share with her husband the desire to get ahead since they both go out to work every day.  The most difficult part of her work is obtaining her own working capital and the expenses that she incurs in paying the annual rent on her land and her son's education expenses.

Very soon, Nelly will harvest 25 sacks of potatoes and 15 sacks of beans which will make her good profits and this will increase her savings with which she is planning to buy her own plot of land very soon.  Nelly belongs to the "San Jerónimo de Queta" community bank and this is her seventh loan with MFP where she feels fulfilled since the support that she receives from her association helps her to improve her crops.  In a few months Nelly will harvest her potatoes and is planning to use her loan money to buy 2 bags of pea seeds and several sacks of potato which she will spread over her farmland after her harvest.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and sacks of organic manure

loans.name: Maria Talquita

texts.es:
Maria de 57 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un pequeño negocio de ventas de comidas. Trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 22h00pm.   

Vende comidas en un puesto de la calle, cada palto lo realiza con pescados y yucas. Tiene mucha afluencia de gente por eso quiere continuar con su negocio. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para el futuro pero por ahora quiere comprar pescados y mesas para tener la facilidad de hacer mas platos. En el futuro quiere tener un local en su domicilio para tener su restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old. She is a hardworking woman who has a small business selling food. She works from 7:30 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.  

She sells food from a street locale. She makes each dish with yucca and fish. There are a lot of people and that's why she wants to continue with her business. She aspires to a lot in the future but for now she wants to buy fish and tables to be able to make more dishes. In the future she wants to have a locale in her house to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy fish and tables.

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en: Ghazi is a 34-year-old married man living in Chtoura with his wife and child. Ghazi repairs car wheels and has been a mechanic since 2005. He is the only mechanic in the region and most of his clients are neighbors, relatives and friends. Ghazi is a hard worker and is well known in his region. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua/Kiva in order to improve his business and to buy necessary tools. Ghazi hopes to provide a secure life and the best education to his family. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary tools

loans.name: Margarita Aracely

texts.es: La señora Margaría Z. tiene un puesto donde vende tacos y hamburguesas el cual es una de las fuentes de ingresos para su familia. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder hacerle una ampliación a su negocio, para poder darles a sus clientes un mejor servicio y a la vez atender a más gente y que su negocio siga creciendo. Ella y su esposo el señor Ismael Beltrán trabajan así que él le ayudara con los gastos de la casa así como de sus tres hijos para que ella utilice los ingresos del local para pagar este crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita Z. has a stand where she sells tacos and hamburgers; this is one of her family’s sources of income.  She is asking for a loan to expand the business in order to provide better customer service and tend to more people so that the business will continue growing.  

She and her husband, Ismael Beltrán, work so he will help her with household expenses as well as those of their three children so that she can use the profits from the food stand to repay this loan.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Manuel Arturo

texts.es: El Sr. Manuel Arturo solicito un crédito con nosotros para la compra D. un puesto semi fijo en el cual desea poner a la venta sus antojitos este  puesto se colocaría afuera D. su casa  obteniendo  mayor vista por lo cual obtendría mayores ventas y así mejoraría su economía,  además  el trabaja  D.  guardia en las  mañanas  y esto le  permitiría vender  almuerzos a  sus  compañeros D. trabajo.
texts.en: Manuel Arturo asked us for a loan to buy a semi-portable stand to sell his fast food snacks from.  He would set it up outsiD. his house so he’d be more visible thus increasing sales and improving his economy.  In addition, he works mornings as a Security Guard and would be able to sell lunches to his coworkers.

loans.use: To buy a cart to sell food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: J Trinidad

texts.es: El señor J Trinidad es un señor trabajador que cuenta con un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Miscelánea G.” donde el tiene una venta de abarrotes en general desde hace 10 años. Este negocio lo atiende el y su esposa; aunque ya son personas grandes quieren seguir trabajado para el sostén de ellos mismos, pues sus hijos ya se encuentran casados y no quieren ser una carga para ellos. Este negocio tiene de todo como refrescos, comida enlatada, botanas y mucho mas, solo que ahora el señor Trinidad quiere comprar mercancía para estar bien surtido y así generar  mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sr. J Trinidad has a grocery business called “Miscelánea G.” that he has owned for ten years. He and his wife manage this business. Despite their age, Sr. Trinidad and his wife want to continue working to support themselves because their children are married and they do not want to become a burden on them. Their business has everything ranging from soft drinks, canned goods, to snack foods and many other items.

Sr. Trinidad wants to buy merchandise so that his store will be well-stocked, thus enabling him to generate more revenue.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase electronics to sell

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es: María Amparo A. G. es una mujer muy emprendedora y a pesar de las adversidades que le ha ofrecido la vida, ha salido adelante con la frente en alto, hace ya tiempo se divorcio y quedo a su cargo una niña discapacitada que necesita cuidados especiales. Por lo que se dedico a la venta de productos por catalogo y distribución de vales para zapatos trabajos que puede realizar desde su casa para no descuidar a su hija. Amparo se ve en la necesidad de arreglar su baño, instalando vitromuro para que de mejor aspecto y limpieza.
texts.en: María Amparo A. G. is an enterprising woman.  Despite the adversity she has had to face in life, María has been able to rise above it.  She has been divorced for some time and has custody of her disabled daughter who requires special care.  María earns her living by selling products through catalogs and distributing vouchers for shoes.  She is able to work from home so that she can take care of her daughter.  María Amparo needs to repair her bathroom and install tiles in order to improve its appearance and cleanliness.

loans.use: Repair a bathroom & install tiling

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es: Gabino G. G. y su esposa desean construir su propio patrimonio, actualmente viven en casa de una de sus hijas por lo que desean independizarse para tener su propio espacio. Gabino se preocupa por el bienestar de su hija pues ya es grande y quiere que ella tenga la mayor privacidad para su familia. El adquirió un terreno para ir construyendo poco a poco su vivienda, para esto el necesita comprar material y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Gabino G. G. and his wife want to build on their own property. They currently live at the house of one of his daughters who wants to be independent and have her own space. Gabino is concerned about his daughter’s welfare now that she is an adult. He wants her to have more privacy for her family.

Gabino already acquired a piece of land on which he can gradually build his house. He needs to purchase materials and pay for labor.

loans.use: Begin the construction of his house

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana M. R. desde hace varios años quedo viuda, por lo tanto tuvo que salir adelante para poder cubrir los gastos de la familia, aunque recibe pensión por viudez solo cubre lo indispensable. Para tener un ingreso extra Juana elabora tortillas de harina para vender en paquetes de 10 a un bajo costo, con este negocio ya 8 años al que desea comprar  mercancía para generar más ganancias.
texts.en: Sra. Juana M. R. has been a widow for several years.  She has had to move forward in order to cover the family expenses.  Juana receives a widow’s pension but it only covers the essentials.  In order to earn extra income, she makes flour tortillas and sells them in packets of 10 for a low price.  She has eight years of experience in this business and wants to buy supplies in order to generate more profits.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making tortillas

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es:
El señor Cornelio I. tiene ya más de 29 años dedicándose a la preparación y venta de platillos de mariscos. 
A su negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de alimentos y algo de inmobiliario pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación en este crédito. 
Planea pagar el préstamo con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que el vive solo y este negocio es la fuente que tiene de ingresos para el.
texts.en: Mr. Cornelio I. has been preparing and selling seafood dishes for over 29 years.  The business needs more variety of food and some furniture and equipment but he lacks the necessary funds for the investment which is why he’s asking for your cooperation in this loan.  He plans to repay the loan with profits from the business since he lives alone and the business is his source of income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Claudia Iveet

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señorita Claudia Iveet A. le esta haciendo falta los acabados el exterior en la planta alta de la casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se esta encargando de realizar la mejorar. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de ingreso que obtiene como empleada de una clínica como enfermera. 
Desea mejorar su casa ya que es el patrimonio que le dejo su papa a ella y a su mama que es una persona ya mayor de edad y quien esta bajo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Claudia Iveet A.’s house is lacking exterior finishing touches on the second story.  She is asking for a loan to buy materials and to pay labor costs to the person doing the improvements.

She plans to repay the loan with part of the income she earns employed as a Nurse at a clinic.

She wants to improve her house for it is the estate her father left her and her mother, who is a senior citizen and in her care

loans.use: To complete the finishings on the outside of her house.

loans.name: Cesáreo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Cesareo T. le está haciendo falta algunas mejorar en el exterior de la casa, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora que requiere su casa.
Es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así comprar el material y contratar a una persona que realice los acabados que necesita su casa. 
Don Cesario es empleado del Servicio Postal Mexicano en el área de repartidos de correo, con este ingreso pagara el crédito ya que es viudo y sus hijos ya tiene su propia familia.
texts.en:
Cesáreo T.’s house needs some improvements done to the exterior, but he does not have the necessary money to make the improvements that his house needs. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy materials and hire a person to finish his house.

Cesáreo works for the Mexican Postal Service in the mail delivery department. He will pay off the loan will this income, as he is a widower and his children already have their own family.

loans.use: Expansion and finishes to the exterior of his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Manuel C. E. utilizara su crédito en la construcción de una barda argumenta que así sus hijos tendrán mas seguridad , su patrimonio   estará protegido   y  podrá  llevar a  cabo su  proyecto  ya  que  su   familia  representa  lo  mas  valioso  en su  vida.
texts.en: Mr. Manuel C. E. will use his loan for the construction of a fence so that his children will have more security and his personal assets will be protected. He will be able to carry out his project since his family represents the most valued part of his life.

loans.use: Construction of a fence

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.es:
El señor Apolunio H. tiene ya más de 10 años dedicándose a la elaboración de muebles de madera.
A su negocio le está haciendo falta materia para realizar unos pedidos de muebles que tiene que entregar, es por eso que solicita un préstamo  y así poder comprar el material que necesita para terminar los muebles a tiempo y sus clientes queden satisfechos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio, ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en: Apolonio H. has more than 10 years experience in making wooden furniture.  Currently, his business is running low on supplies to fill outstanding furniture orders.  He is requesting a loan to buy the materials necessary to finish the requested items on time in order to keep his clients happy.  He plans to repay the loan with part of the earnings from the sales, as furniture sales are the family's source of income.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felipe Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Felipe Ángel es una persona muy seria, trabajadora y responsable en su trabajo, el desea el préstamo por que quiere acabar de construir  el cuarto que les esta haciendo a su familia ya que se preocupa por el bienestar  de  ella  y desea que tengan  una  excelente  calidad  de   vida.
texts.en: Mr. Felipe Ángel is a very serious person, hard-working and responsible in his work. He would like this loan to finish constructing the room he is building for his family as he is worried about their well-being and would like them to have an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Pedro Emmanuel

texts.es: El Joven Pedro Emmanuel I., es el hijo mayor de la Sra.  María Concepción S. y viven juntos en el domicilio que con esfuerzos adquirió el joven Pedro, y como los dos están trabajando ellos han decidido protegerse de la inseguridad ampliando la barda que cerrara el frente de su domicilio, ya que la casa se queda sola durante el día, se van a trabajar sin dejar de pensar que alguien pudiera meterse a su domicilio es por esta razón que ellos piensan que al terminar de construir la barda, quedara mas seguro su  domicilio agradecen a esta institución el haber otorgado el crédito que los ayudara y apoyara a llevar a cabo su tan anhelado proyecto.
texts.en:
Pedro Emmanuel I. is Mrs. María Concepción S.’s oldest son.  They live together in a house Pedro acquired through much effort.  Since they both are employed they want to increase security expanding the wall that will close off the front of their house because the house is unattended all day; they go to work always concerned that someone could break into their house and this is why they want to finish building the wall.  Their house will be more secure.

They are grateful to the institution for having granted the loan that will help them and support their effort to carry out their much wanted project.

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a wall around her property.

loans.name: Iris  Emili

texts.es: L. Srita  Iris Emili, es una joven que vive en casa D. sus padres elL. actualmente  trabaja  en una maquiladora para  solventar  sus  propios  gastos y también aporta para L. ayuda económica D. sus padres ya que forma parte D. su familia,  elL. solicito el crédito porque se quiere independizar un poco y tener un poco mas D. privacidad en su domicilio, platicando  con sus  padres decidieron construir una habitación mas en L. casa para que Emili  obtenga   un poco  mas  D.  privacidad  y al mismo tiempo adquiera  responsabilidad  en sus actos y en su persona.
texts.en: Iris Emili, is a young woman who lives in her parents' home.  She currently works in an assembly plant to earn money to pay her own expenses and to contribute financially to her parents, since they are all part of the same family.  She is requesting the loan because she wants to make herself a little more independent, and she wants a little more privacy in her home.  After discussing with her parents, they decided to add a room on to their house so that Emili can have a little more privacy and at the same time take more responsibiltiy for her actions and for herself.

loans.use: To add on a room to her house.

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Maria De Los Ángeles C. tiene ya mas de un años dedicándose a la venta  de artículos escolares.
Este negocio es una fuente de ingresos para su familia, esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en mercancía ya que desea también vender productos para fiestas infantiles, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la inversión que su negocio requiere.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá del negocio, ya que su esposo el señor Fidencio Enrique Amaro se encargara de los gastos familiares, con el ingreso que tiene de su trabajo como constructor independiente.
texts.en: Señora Maria De Los Ángeles C. has been selling school supplies for more than a year.  This business provides a source of income for her family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise as she wants to also sell products for children's parties, but she doesn't have the money necessary to invest in her business.  She plans to make her payments with the earnings from her business since her husband, Señor Fidencio Enrique Amaro, is responsible for the family's expenses with his income as an independent builder.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for children's parties

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Amelia Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Amelia G. tiene una estética a la cual le está haciendo falta mercancía, por lo que la ella vino con nosotros a solicitar  un préstamo para poder comprar más productos para la estética y así poder tener más clientes y no darle un mal servicio a los clientes que ya tiene, ya que este trabajo es su única fuente de ingresos.
Ella es soltera y vive con su  madre, por lo que está muy interesada en poder comprar la nueva mercancía porque así podrá brindarle a su mama una mejor calidad de vida y a ella misma también.
Ella planea pagar este crédito con algunos de los ingresos de dicha estética.
texts.en:
Señora Amelia G. has a beauty salon that is lacking some merchandise. For this reason she came to us to apply for a loan, so that she can buy more products for her salon and thus be able to have more customers and not give poor service to the customers she already has. This work is her only source of income.

She is single and lives with her mother. She is very interested in being able to buy the new merchandise, because in this way she can provide a better quality of life for her mother and also for herself.

She plans to pay back the loan with some of the income from her beauty salon.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan S. is a married man, who lives with his family in Korolyovo. To earn a living, Ivan sells household cleaning and personal products in the central marketplace of his small hometown. Ivan explains that small business ventures like his are the only source of income for families in remote parts of the Ukraine. Ivan has been in this business for 9 years. Currently, his inventory amounts to 70,000 UAH, and his income is approximately 6,000 UAH per month.

Ivan states that his business is characterized by stability and positive performance. The goods that he sells are always in demand, because people need dishwasher and laundry soap, shampoos, and other household products to go about their lives. Ivan would like to see his business grow in the future, which is why he is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 UAH ($2,525). The loan proceeds would be used to increase his working capital. Ivan’s goal is to open another retail location in the near future.

loans.use: To improve and expand his business by increasing working capital

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a farmer. She grows early spring vegetables, i.e., radishes, tomatoes, and cucumbers. Ludmila started her business 32 years ago due to difficult financial situations in the family. She was forced to find ways to feed her family and decided to try her luck in farming. Presently, Ludmila has already invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in her greenhouse business. Her net profit amounts to 2,300 Grivnyas a month. 

Ludmila is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, plastic film, wood, and fertilizers for her greenhouses. Being a commercial farmer, Ludmila tries to produce good harvests and generate additional income as a result. Therefore, she wants to invest in quality polyethylene film that will retain heat and to purchase good seeds and fertilizers to ensure timely harvests.  

Ludmila is married and has a grown daughter named Anna. She lives in a predominantly agricultural area of Ukraine in the small town of Gladkovka.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, plastic film, wood, and fertilizers

loans.name: El Samaritano 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
El Samaritano 3 & 4 (Samaritan) Group is looking to start a new loan for its ten entrepreneurs through Esperanza International, Kiva's partner. Many of the group members sell clothing. Others have small convenience stores and beauty salons.

Modesto is one of the group members. He is a single man that raised six children with his ex-wife. They are all grown up now. Modesto still supports the younger ones in their studies. The older ones use to work with him in his tangerine plantation. This is one of Modesto's businesses; he sells tangerines wholesale in the public market. 

Modesto operates an irrigation and herbicide products business. He will invest this loan in herbicide products and he is planning to invest in a new seedtime of tangerines. He enjoys working in the field and one of his dreams is to have a big farm and live tranquil on it. With the will of God and this loan, he will see his dreams come true. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy herbicide products

loans.name: The Tamarrneh United Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Tamarrneh United” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the eastern city of Kenema. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and gain better profit. 

Fatmata B. is the leader of this group. Fatmata was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is 32 years of age and married to a trader. They have two children. 

Fatmata sells slippers and has been doing this business for 10 years now. With the help of this loan, she will buy slippers in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy slippers in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Take & Pay Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Take & Pay” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Yussuf C. is the leader of this group. The 28 year old is married to a businesswoman and they have three children. Yussuf has been a businessman for five years now; he sells house building material - locks, nails, wires, etc. With his share of this loan, he will buy house building materials in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of house building materials to add to his business

loans.name: One Ward Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “One Ward” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan that these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Thaimu B.. Thaimu is aged 34; he was born in Port Loko, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Currently he is residing in Kenema together with his wife and two children. His wife is a trader and his children are attending school. Thaimu sells drums, tarpaulins and rain coats. He has been a businessman for seven years now. With his share of the loan, he will buy more drums, tarpaulins and raincoats to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy drums, tarpaulins and raincoats to add to his business

loans.name: Sandoh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sandoh” group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs have accessed from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sia F.. Sia is aged 31; she was born in Kenema city where she is currently residing together with her husband and two children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending school. Sia sells bread, soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, foot-brushes, etc. and has been doing this business for 10 years now. With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy bread, soap, toothpaste, toothbrushes, foot-brushes, etc. wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Nice Social Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Nice Social” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person in order to invest in their businesses. 

Mohamed B. is the leader of this group. A native of Kailahum, Mohamed is 28 years old, married with two children. Mohamed sells bulgur wheat, beans and cassava leaves. He has been running this business for eight years now. With the help of this loan, Mohamed is going to expand his business by buying bulgur wheat, beans and cassava leaves in larger quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of bulgur wheat, beans and cassava leaves to sell

loans.name: Gbotima I Group

texts.en:
These are small scale businesswomen in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and earn more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, and feeding and clothing them. 

Baby A. is the leader of this group. She was born in Pujehun 45 years ago. Baby is married and has four children. Her husband is a monthly salaried worker and her children are attending schools. Baby sells fish. She has been doing this business for 10 years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying fish wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy fish wholesale to add to current stock

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of the “God Bless” group from Kenema. They are small scale businesspeople who are based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Adamsay C.. Adamsay is aged 32 and was born in Yeli village. She is married to a businessman and they have two children. Adamsay sells fruits and vegetables. She has been doing business for 15 years now. She will use her share of this loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase grocery goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair their taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shahriniso

texts.ru: Эргашева Шахринисо жительница Шахринавского района. Ей 48 лет. Она вдова, имеет 4 детей. Образование-среднее. Работает на рынке "Дехкон". Арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Shahriniso E. lives in Shahrinav district. She is 48 years old, widowed with four children. She has a secondary education. Ms. E. works at the Dekhkon market where she rents a small space to sell fruit. She has been in this business for 15 years and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory and sales.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Чаборов Рустам проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ему 43 года. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сыновья находятся в городе Москве. Сам Рустам уже четыре года как занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Rustam C. lives in the J.Rumi region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a homemaker. His sons are now in Moscow. Rustam has been doing animal husbandry for four years now. He breeds large cattle for future resale. He is taking out this loan to buy large cattle to increase their headcount.

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa, de 53 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 3 hijos mayores, su yerno y sus 4 nietos, juntos y con muchas ganas de alcanzar el progreso habitan en un barrio populoso ubicado en la  zona norte de la ciudad.  

Desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de comida y refrescos oriundos  del norte del Perú. Aprendió observando como su madre mezclaba los diferentes ingredientes para obtener exquisitos potajes, y luego que pasaron los años, instaló su propio negocio en un mercado mayorista de la zona donde vive; aunque el local es alquilado. Dice que el trabajo es tranquilo, pues ya tiene clientes fijos, lo que le permite obtener ganancias diarias,  de esta manera logro sacar  adelante a sus 3 hijos; y en la actualidad la menor le ayuda  en la venta de comida. Lo que no le gusta es que hace algunos meses reubicaron a los comerciantes del mercado, pero a pesar de esta dificultad tiene muchos comensales. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio e implementarlo con mejores utensilios para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus comensales. 

Josefa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de ingredientes que necesita al por mayor, ya que desea aumentar la cantidad de platillos que ofrece al día, así espera mejorar sus ganancias.

Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas, pues no quiere decepcionar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
53-year old Josefa lives in her own home with her three adult children, son-in-law, and four grandchildren. All have a great desire for a better future. They live in a densely populated neighbourhood in the north part of the city.

Ever since she was young, Josefa has earned her living by selling the traditional food and drink of northern Peru. She learned by watching how her mother mixed the different ingredients resulting in delicious soups. Then the years passed and eventually Josefa started her own business in a wholesale market in the area where she lives. She rents a stall there. The work is peaceful as she has regular clients giving her steady income with which to support her three children. Her youngest now helps her sell food.

One problem has been that a few months ago the market stallholders were relocated but in spite of that, there were still many visitors to her stall. As Josefa is an enterprising women, she is planning to expand her business in the future and equip it with better cooking utensils so she can provide her customers with better service.

This is her second loan with Kiva partner MFP and she promises to make the repayments punctually as she doesn’t want to disappoint all the people who made donations to allow her to continue working in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 45 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 20 años cría animal vacuno, actividad que le toma todo el día, del mismo modo cuida también de sus cuyes. Adicionalmente a esta actividad,  siembra papa, maíz, arveja, cebolla entre otros. Diariamente se dedica en proporcionarle alimento balanceado a sus animales, así como alfalfa y otros productos que necesitan sus vacas para producir más  leche. Por los años de intenso trabajo ha visto  que su economía  ha ido creciendo poco a poco aún en momentos difíciles, razón por la cual esta planeando  adquirir más animales, así como tener más extensiones de terreno para sembrar. Es su  crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su establo, así como su reciente granja de cuyes.
texts.en: Yolanda is 45, and lives with her husband and 2 children in her own house. For more than 20 years, she has raised cattle, work that takes all day. She cares for her cuyes [guinea pigs; sometimes raised for meat in parts of Latin America] in the same way. In addition, she grows potatoes, corn, peas, onions, and other crops. Daily she works to portion out feed to her animals, as well as alfalfa and other products that her cows need to produce more milk. Through the years of intense labor, she has seen her finances improve little by little, though she still has difficult times. For this reason, she is planning to acquire more animals, as well as extend her croplands. She has had previous loans through MFP and has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She is glad to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people. She is very happy to have the financial support and is grateful to those people who will fund this loan, which will be very helpful in the growth of her business. With the requested loan, she will purchase building materials to improve the infrastructure of her stable and also of her new cuye farm.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to improve her stable and cuye farm.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 52 años, vive con sus 2 hijas en casa de un familiar. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la compra y venta de animales de ganado ovino, las lleva a lugares de espacios abiertos para alimentarlas y también tiene sus terrenos de cultivo, lugar  donde  siembra maíz  y habas, y los fines de semana vende sus ovejas y compra otras para engordarla  varios durante meses para luego venderlas. Cuando es la temporada de cosecha vende al por mayor de manera directa. Para María que es muy dedicada en su trabajo es muy ventajoso trabajar de esta manera ya que  es un aporte importante en la economía de su hogar porque su esposo que trabaja en otra ciudad es el principal sostén de su casa. En adelante planea tener más animales  y acondicionar un establo para mantener a sus animales ya que en la actualidad guarda a sus ovejas en el establo de uno de sus tíos. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que la ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos, promete ser puntual en sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción como adobes, palos y calaminas para  construir su establo de animales.
texts.en: María is 52, and lives with her 2 daughters in a relative's house. For 12 years she has worked buying and selling sheep. She brings them to open pastures to feed them and she also has lands where she grows corn and beans. On the weekends she sells her sheep and buys others to fatten them up for several months before selling them. During the harvest season, she sells wholesale directly. For María, who is very dedicated in her work, it is very advantageous to work this way since it is an important source of economic support for her household because her husband, who works in another city, is the primary breadwinner of the house. For the future, she plans to have more animals and to build a stable for her animals since right now she keeps her sheep in a stable owned by one of her uncles. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has the financial support that will help her increase her income. She promises to be on time with her payments and is grateful to those people who will be lenders for the loan she is requesting, which will be very helpful in building her business. With the requested loan, she will purchase construction materials such as adobe for bricks, wood, and roofing materials to build her animal stable.

loans.use: Purchase materials to build her stable.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 46 años, es viuda y vive con sus  3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 17 años realiza las tareas agrícolas con ayuda de sus hijos que en ese entonces eran unos niños. Hoy posee varias cabezas de reses y ovejas. Además cuenta con algunos terrenos donde cultiva hortalizas, papa y quinua, y que son vendidos a sus vecinos y en el centro de la ciudad. Para ella es indispensable ambas actividades y casi todo su tiempo se dedica a ello, cuidando que sus animales estén bien alimentados, así como evitar que los insectos no perjudiquen sus cultivos. Ella anhela seguir intensificándose en estas actividades y  mejorar la raza de sus vacas. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita,  comprará sacos  de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra y también  comprará verduras al por mayor.
texts.en: Flor is 46 years old.  She is a widow and lives in her own house with her 3 children.  For the last 17 years, she has done agricultural work with the help of her children, who were young children when they started.  Now she has several heads of cattle and sheep.  She also has some land where she grows vegetables, potatoes, and quinoa, which are sold to her neighbors and in the city center.  For her, both activities are indispensable, and she spends almost all her time on them, making sure the animals are well-fed and ensuring insects do not damage her crops.  She longs to continue becoming stronger in these activities and to improve the breed of her cows.  This is her third credit with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments.  She is also happy to be part of her communal bank because all of its members are responsible and very supportive people.  She thanks the people who will arrange the loan she is asking for.  It will be very useful to her in the progress of her business.  With the loan, she will buy bags of fertilizer for her next sowing season, and she will also buy wholesale vegetables.

loans.use: To buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 50 años que vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios nativos de su región y los comercializa en otras ciudades  donde carece este producto; como: queso, truchas, papa y maíz, en los que son  transportados cada 15 días. Ella asegura en colocar la mercadería a clientes de confianza, por que saben que son responsables con el pago. Disfruta del trabajo que realiza y que le permite viajar constantemente además de ser  una fuente muy importante  que suple las necesidades económicas de sus hijos, por esta razón desea continuar en este negocio. Es su crédito número 15 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar mercadería y aprovechar esta época del año en que mejoran sus ventas.
texts.en: Antonia is 50 years old and lives in her own house with her two children. For the last 15 years, she has sold food products native to her region.
