Hace más de 3 años vende cosméticos y ropa, mercadería que lo exhibido en una vitrina, que se encuentra en su casa, esto para su cuidado y a la vez para cuando lleguen sus clientes y pueda apreciar la variedad de productos que tiene Ana. Asimismo ella dispone de un catalogo para mostrar a sus clientes cuando los visita en su casa, así recauda más pedidos y eso implica más ganancias. Por otro lado, el negocio de venta de ropa lo realiza de vez en cuando en la minería donde trabaja su esposo, así aprovecha a visitarlo. Con el tiempo ha ido creciendo su capital de trabajo de la cual se siente muy orgullosa porque  ayuda en la economía de su hogar y la anima a continuar adelante con este negocio, ahora tiene la proyección de tener su tienda de ropa y productos de belleza. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, considera que el crédito es un gran apoyo financiero y de su parte ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio, promete no defraudarles. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en prendas de vestir y cosméticos para esta nueva campaña de ventas que va a realizar.
texts.en: Ana, 41, lives with one of her 3 children and her husband in a house owned by her mother.  She has made a living selling clothing and cosmetics for 3 years.  She has a display case at her house where she keeps her merchandise, so her customers can easily see what she has to sell.  She also keeps catalogs for her customers so that the can see other products, something that allows her to collect more orders and increase her earnings.  Her clothing business, on the other hand, is based at the mine where her husband works.  The businesses have grown over the years, something about which Ana is tremendously proud because it has allowed her to help with household expenses.  Her past efforts have spurred her to go on with the businesses and she now wants to open a store where she can sell her clothing and cosmetics.  This is Ana's second MFP loan and she has shown that she can repay a loan on time.  She tells us that being able to get credit this way is very helpful to her.  She also wants to thank the other members of her community bank because they are responsible people who help one another.  She is also grateful to all of you who extend loans to fund businesses like hers and she is committed to repaying this loan.  Ana will use the loan to buy more clothing and cosmetics for an upcoming sales campaign.

loans.use: Stock clothing and cosmetics for sales business.

loans.name: Tegal Badeng Indah Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut S. is a farmer and housewife. She has two children: one is married and one is still in school. Ni Ketut S. started a pig business in an effort to support her family. She keeps two pigs. Ni Ketut S. took out a 1,500,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) loan for the first time from MUK which will be used to buy two more pigs. Ni Ketut has plans to save the income from the sale of four pigs, because she has plans to renovate her home. She has a dream – a comfortable home to live in with the whole family.

loans.use: To buy two more pigs

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.en: Ni Ketut S. got a loan for the first time, which she will use as venture capital to raise her pigs. Ni Ketut S. works to help her husband who is only a day laborer off, so does not have a steady income every month. She lives with her husband and one of her children. Every day she spends 25,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) for the needs of the kitchen, 4,000 IDR for their children's school supplies, and 100,000 IDR for electricity and water.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: I Made

texts.en: I Made L. A. works as a traveling salesman, selling all sorts of snacks to supply stalls. He works from morning to evening servicing food stalls that have become his customers to support his family. I Made L. lives with his wife, two children and both parents in his simple house. Every day he spends 10,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) for kitchen needs, 5,000 IDR for the school fees of his son, and 100,000 IDR for electricity and water. This loan will be used as capital to increase turnover of snacks.

loans.use: To use as capital

loans.name: Sari Indah Group

texts.en: Ni Putu S., age 42, is the mother of two boys. In addition to being a housewife, she is also a pig farmer to sustain the family. She has wrestled with this pig business for 12 years. At the beginning, she only had two types of fattening pigs and now she is raising four piglets. The piglets are just two months old. These pigs will be maintained for four months. Ni Putu S. wants to advance her livestock business, especially increase her pig population. With the capital received, Ni Putu S. will buy three piglets and use the rest of the money to purchase feed. Information about Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) This loan is being serviced by Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK), a microfinance institution headquartered in Bali Indonesia. MUK follows a cooperative model offering microenterprise development services to its clients, including microloans, savings programs, and business consultation services to help small business owners and their families improve their everyday lives. MUK envisions a prosperous world free from poverty. It is dedicated to raising society’s awareness of environmental issues and to providing opportunities for people in chronic poverty to improve their lives. MUK provides services to all lower income people throughout Bali without consideration of race, religion or culture. Mitra Usaha Kecil is dedicated to empowering people, creating jobs, stimulating small businesses and strengthening communities. For more information about MUK, please visit our Kiva partner page and website. Also, consider supporting MUK and its borrowers by joining our Kiva lending team Friends of Mitra Usaha Kecil. .

loans.use: To buy three piglets

loans.name: Nusa Sejahtera Group

texts.en:
I Made R. W. lives in the Nusasari village with his wife and two children. He works every day as a farmer and has also developed a pig farm for his home business. I Made R. W. has been raising pigs for 15 years and over that time has managed to earn 300,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) per month.

I Made R. W. decided to continue borrowing to increase his business capital and livestock. This loan will be used to buy one sow for 1,200,000 IDR and pig feed with the rest. Profit from the sale of pork will be fully used to improve his family's economy.

loans.use: To buy one sow and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase furniture for her kindergarten

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying more motor spare parts for increased stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Clearing his child's school fees and paying his labourer to work on the farm

loans.name: Jasiri Group

texts.en: Ombeni J., who is in his early twenties, is single. He has been running a secondhand clothes business for one year. He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Ombeni's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He hopes for a loan to increase his business. His dream is to have a good stock of clothes. Ombeni will share this loan with his loan group, Jasiri, which has a total of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Ombeni is the man in front in a white shirt.

loans.use: To increase his business

loans.name: Maclaren Group

texts.en:
Magdalena L., who is in her late forties, is married with five children.  She has had a charcoal business for fifteen years.  She works from 6am to 8pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Magdalena's 2nd Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. (A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.) She has paid back her previous loan successfully. She hopes to obtain a new loan to increase her business.

Magdalena will share this loan with her loan group, Maclaren, which has nine members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Magdalena is in front wearing a yellow dress.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Tegemeo Group

texts.en:
Asili S., who is in his early fifties, is married with five children.  He has been operating a second hand clothes business since 2007.  He works from 8am to 5pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Asili's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his capital and managed to buy a good stock of clothes, and has paid back his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to increase his stock.  His dream is to open a shop for selling food.

Asili will share this loan with his loan group, T., which has a total of eighteen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Asili is 1st on the right in a brown t-shirt.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Tushikamane Group

texts.en:
Rukia S., who is in her early thirties, is married with two children.  She has been running a fish business for five years.  She collects dry fish from upcountry at least twice a week.  She is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rukia's 5th Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. (A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.) She has paid off her previous loan successfully. She hopes to obtain a new loan to increase her stock of fish to sell.  Her dream is to build her own house.

Rukia will share this loan with her loan group, Tushikamane, which has a total of nine members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Karafuu Group

texts.en:
Radegunda K., who is in her late twenties, is married with two children. She has been running a charcoal business for one year. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Radegunda's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to increase the stock of her charcoal business. 

Radegunda will share this loan with her loan group, Karafuu, which has a total of nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Radegunda is in green, first on the right in the second row.

loans.use: To increase the stock of charcoal

loans.name: Upendo Mloganzira Group

texts.en:
Upendo F., who is in her early thirties, is married with two children. For the past year, her business has been selling second-hand shoes from door to door. She works from 11:00am to 4:00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Upendo's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to increase her capital. Her dream is to open a shop and start selling shoes in one place.

Upendo will share this loan with her loan group Upendo Mloganzila. The group has a total of 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture Upendo is in front holding a baby.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Antokia Group

texts.en:
Justina S., who is in her mid-twenties, is married and has one child.  She has a tailoring business and sells juice as well. She has been in this business for two years and works from 12 noon to 9 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Justina's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase her supplies.  Her dream is to open a small shop for selling radio cassettes.

Justina will share this loan with her loan group, Antokia, which has a total of fifteen members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Justina is in front, in a black blouse.

loans.use: To increase her business supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Awulatu

texts.en: Awulatu I. sells provisions and clothing at Akaa Kkrom near Abura, a business she has operated for five years. She is married and has a child. Her income is combined with that of her husband, who is a seller of spare parts, in order to pay their household expenses. This loan will help to expand Awulatu's clothing business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: To expand her clothing sales business

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza M. sells cooking utensils and millet at Akaa Kkrom near Abura, a business she has operated for three years. She is married and has three children. She helps her husband in the payment of the children's school fees and the family's utility bills. 

Her loan will be used to buy additional millet to supply to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy addional millet to supply to her customers

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama I. is married and has two children. She has received a senior high education. Mariama sells fresh groundnuts, millet, beans and other items at Akaa krom near Abura in Cape Coast. She has been in this trade for 12 years. Her husband is a security man. She adds her income to that of her husband’s in payment of school fees and utility bills. 

Mariama will use the loan to purchase more cereals for resale. Any incremental profit will be reinvested back into her business. She is showing the millet that she sells.

loans.use: Mariama will use the loan to purchase more cereals for resale

loans.name: Halimatu

texts.en:
Halimatu Y. sells cosmetics and soap at Akaa Krom near Abura in Cape Coast, a business she has operated for 12 years. She was educated through the senior high school level. She and her husband have five dependants. Halimatu uses her income to assist her husband, who works as a driver, in the payment of the family's school fees and utility bills. 

Halimatu will use this loan to purchase more boxes of soap to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Halimatu plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more boxes of soap to expand her business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama A. makes and sells banku, a dish made from corn and konkonte (cassava flour) at Korfofordo near Jukwa in Cape Coast. (In the picture, she is shown holding a bowl of konkonte.) She has been in this trade for seven years. A widow with four children, she is the breadwinner of the home, and Mariama makes sure that the needs of her children are met. This loan will help her expand her cooking business. With the profits from her increased income, she plans eventually to build a restaurant.

loans.use: To expand her cooking business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther E. is married to a driver. She operates a provision shop in Korfofordo near Jukwa, which she has been doing for five years. Esther adds her income to her husband’s income to maintain their home. She will use this loan to purchase more provisions to restock her shop. Esther plans to plough back her additional income.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to restock her shop

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: For 30 years, Efua E. has made and sold doughnuts and porridge at Korfofordo near Jukwa. She serves the porridge with milk and bread. Her husband is a farmer, and Efua uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and other household expenditures. Efua will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize in order to produce her wares in larger quantities for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize in order to produce her wares in larger quantities for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells maize and also makes Fantey kenkey [corn dough] for sale at Korfofordo near Jukwa in Cape Coast. She is a widow and has 4 children. Ama has been preparing kenkey for 6 years. As the sole bread winner in her home, she uses her income to see to the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be added to her income to purchase additional bags of maize for sale. She anticipates buying land from the new profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional bags of maize for sale

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba K. sells provisions and food items at Korfofordo near Jukwa in Cape Coast.  Araba has a junior high educational background. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a mason. Her business is just a year old, so she needs a loan to expand her provision business. She adds her income to that of her husband to settle the household expenditures. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba K. is divorced and has 1 child. She has been through junior high school. Aba operates a beauty salon at Korfofordo near Jukwa, which she has been doing for 12 years. Aba uses her income to feed, clothe and educate her child. Aba will use the loan to restock her shop so she can supply most of the products requested by her customers. Aba plans to reinvest profits back into her business.

loans.use: To restock beauty supplies

loans.name: Rosemary Ekua

texts.en: Rosemary Ekua A. sells cosmetics at Korfofordo near Jukwa in Cape Coast, carrying her wares from one area to another. She has been engaged in this business for about 10 years. Rosemary is divorced with four children and is the sole breadwinner of the home. She has a senior high school educational background. The funds from this loan will be added to her existing income in order to buy more cosmetics to offer for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rosemary plans eventually to build a cosmetics shop.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to offer for sale

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba W. is a vendor of maize, beans, and charcoal. She buys her wares at a market called Teshiman and offers them for sale at Korfofordo near Jukwa, Cape Coast. She is a widow taking care of four children. This loan will go a long way to help to purchase goods in larger quantities as the cost of transportation keeps increasing. Araba plans to increase her savings so as to provide a meaningful education for her children with the new profits expected from the loan. In the picture, she is standing by the bags of charcoal she sells.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans, and charcoal in larger quantities as the cost of transportation keeps increasing

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua F. is a widow and has four children. Akua sells meat and bags of charcoal at Korfofordo near Jukwa. As a single parent, she is solely responsible for feeding and educating her children. Akua will use the loan to purchase more meat and charcoal in Jukwa for her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Akua plans to build a storage facility for the bags of charcoal. In the picture, she is shown standing by the bags of charcoal she sells.

loans.use: To purchase more meat and charcoal to sell at market

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi E. is a hairdresser in Korfofordo near Jukwa, Cape Coast. She has received a junior high education. She has been a hairdresser for eight years now. She needs a loan to be able to buy more hair products to use when cutting and styling her customers' hair. She is unmarried, so most of her income is used toward the payment of utility bills and her accommodation. Profits from the loan will be reinvested back into her business by building a shop.

loans.use: To buy more hair products to use when cutting and styling her customers' hair

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina T. is married and has one child. Philomina sells maize, yams, cassava, plantains, tomatoes and other food items at Korfofordo near Jukwa in Cape Coast. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the education of her children. Philomina will invest the loan into her business so she buys more food items to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Philomina plans to reinvest it for further growth.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: As a seamstress, Anita S. lives with her five dependents and her husband, a mason, at Jukwa near Abura in Cape Coast. Anita also cooks rice for sale. Her educational background is up to the senior high level. The income she makes from these businesses is added to the income of her husband in the general upkeep of the home. A loan will help buy materials to expand her sewing business. An increase in the profit of her business, as a result of the loan, will be used to build a shop for the sewing business.

loans.use: To buy materials to increase her sewing business

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. makes Fante kenkey [corn dough] for sale at Korfofordo near Jukwa. She is a single parent taking care of four children. Esi has been in this trade for 20 years. She single-handedly takes care of the children. A loan is going to help her expand the kenkey business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To expand the kenkey business

loans.name: Adjoa Esi

texts.en: Adjoa Esi F., a divorced mother of one, has been involved in the production and sale of kenkey (a traditional dish made from ground cornmeal) for about 15 years now. She was educated through junior high school herself, but hopes that her child will attain a higher level of education. As a single parent, she is responsible for the well-being of her child. A loan from you will help her expand her kenkey business. Adjoa plans to use the profits from this loan to save towards the education of her child. In the picture, she is shown with the corn she uses to make the kenkey.

loans.use: To expand her business of making and selling kenkey, a traditional dish made from ground cornmeal

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en: Hagar M. makes a living selling fish and a type of locally-made soap in the town of Korfofordo, which is located near the larger town of Jukwa. She was educated through junior high school and is the mother of one child. Her husband makes a living repairing refrigerators. Hagar devotes her income to paying for the education of her child. Demand for the soap is increasing, and that is why she is applying for a loan to buy more of the ingredients she needs to make soap. She would also like to begin selling other types of soap to her customers.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to make more soap.

loans.name: Abena Kwesi

texts.en: Abena Kwesi A. operates a drinking spot where people pass by to have a drink. She sells bags of water as well. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. She has been through senior high school.  Abena contributes to her husband's income to pay the expenses of the home. This loan will enable her to buy more crates of drinks to sell. The increased income will be invested back into the business for further growth.

loans.use: To buy more crates of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua O. has been selling a variety of food items for the past eight years at Koforidua near Jukwa in the Cape Coast district. Some of these food items are gari (a grain made from cassava), maize and others. She is divorced and she has two children. As a single mother, she makes sure she pays for the household expenses. 

A loan is going to help her purchase more of the food items she sells. The new profit as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into her business. In this picture Ekua is showing some of the maize she sells.

loans.use: to purchase more of the food items she sells

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua F. makes her living by selling corn in Kokowada, near Elmina.  She is married and has five children.  Her income supplements what her husband earns as a teacher, and helps pay for their children’s school fees.
 
With a focus on growing her business, Ekua needs a loan to purchase larger quantities of corn to boost her sales. She plans to reinvest the added earnings back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To purchase corn to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua B. is married and has three children.  She is married to a farmer and makes her living by preparing and selling corn dough and kenkey. Corn dough is usually used for the preparation of kenkey, a popular staple in the Ghanaian diet. The money she earns goes towards school fees. 

To improve her earnings, Efua wants to grow her business. She requires a loan to purchase larger quantities of corn to prepare the kenkey. The extra income from the additional sales will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: To purchase corn to make food for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama E. is from Kokowada, near Elmina, where she has been selling fried fish for the past 20 years. Ama is married to a farmer.  She and her husband have five children.  Her family depends on her income to pay for school fees and utility bills.

To boost her earnings, Ama wants to grow her business. She intends to use the loan to purchase more fish to sell. The extra profits will be reinvested into the business and also set aside for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama P. has been making and selling kenkey, a Ghanaian staple made from fermented corn dough, for the past 15 years. She sells her kenkey in Kokowada near Elmina.  Ama is married and has one child.  Her earnings pays for her child’s school fees. 

With the goal of improving her income, Ama needs a loan to grow her food business. The loan will be used to purchase more corn and other ingredients. She plans to reinvest her earnings back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To buy  ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Ama Esi

texts.en: Ama Esi A. has been preparing and selling smoked fish for a living for six years.  She lives in Kokowada, near Elmina, and is married to a farmer.   Ama and her husband have six children.  Her earnings help pay for their children’s school fees and utility bills.  Her goal is to grow her business and the loan will allow her to purchase more fish. The increased earnings will be reinvested into the business for further growth.

loans.use: To purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is a single mother with seven children. She sells fabrics in Kokowada near Elmina, a trade she has been in for the past six years. 

Given that she is solely responsible for providing for her family, she wants to boost her earnings. The loan will allow her to purchase more fabrics for sale. She intends to reinvest the earnings to grow her business further.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics for sale

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. is divorced and has five children. For the past 10 years, she has made a living by selling items such as soap, steel wool and starch in Kokowada, Elmina. 

As a sole breadwinner, her priority is to bolster her earnings. She plans to do this by growing her business. The loan will allow her to purchase more items for sale. The extra profits will be reinvested back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: The loan will allow her to purchase more items for sale

loans.name: Ekua Pow Grace

texts.en:
Ekua Pow Grace M. is single and comes from Kokowada in Elmina. She has completed her senior high school education. For the past three years, she has made a living by selling food products, such as fish and tinned tomatoes, and other items, such as soap and palm oil. 

She aspires to grow her business and needs a loan to increase the quantity and variety of items she has for sale. She hopes that this will improve sales figures and also grow her customer base. The extra earnings will be plowed back into the business for further growth.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of items she has for sale

loans.name: Esi Awotwi Comfor

texts.en:
Esi Awotwi Comfor A. is a single mother with four children.  She is from Kokowada, near Elmina. For three years, she has made her living selling corn and cassava dough, which people purchase to make banku, a staple in the Ghanaian diet. 

As the sole breadwinner for her family, it is critical to Esi to bolster her earnings by expanding her business. She intends to use the loan to purchase more corn and cassava to prepare more dough for sale. The extra profits will be reinvested into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To purchase corn and cassava to make dough for sale

loans.name: Ekua Essoun Mary

texts.en:
Ekua Essoun Mary K. has been selling banku (a staple made from fermented cassava dough) and stew for the past 9 years. She is from Kokowada, near Elmina, and is married to a farmer. Her earnings help pay for their three children’s education and household utility bills. 

Ekua plans to expand her food business and needs a loan to purchase larger quantities of ingredients. The profits from the extra sales will be reinvested into her business for greater growth.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Simowah Susana

texts.en:
Simowah Susana A. is a single mother of two.  She has been making and selling kenkey at Kokowada near Elmina for the past 20 years. Kenkey is a staple in Ghanian diet made from fermented maize or cassava dough, and usually served with fried fish and pepper sauce. 

To improve her earnings and provide for her children’s education, Simowah wishes to grow her food business. This loan will be used to purchase more maize and other ingredients to expand her food production. The extra profits will be saved for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make kenkey for sale

loans.name: Ama Mary Dum

texts.en: Ama Mary Dum A. has a business producing and and selling Fante kenkey in Kokowada, near Elmina in Cape Coast. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. Ama has been in this trade for 6 years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of maize to expand her kenkey business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy maize to make kenkey

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is a single mother with two children. She makes a living by selling corn in Kokowada near Elmina, Cape Coast. 

To bolster her family’s income, she wants to grow her business. The loan will allow her to purchase more corn for sale. The extra income will be reinvested into her business for further growth.

loans.use: To purchase more corn for sale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba Y. has been selling cassava, an important source of carbohydrates in Ghana and many parts of the world, for 10 years now. Married with three children, she is from Kokowada near Elmina. 

Her income pays for her children’s school fees and also for some of the utility bills. She wants to improve her earnings by growing her business and needs the loan to do so. The loan will be used to purchase more cassava to increase her sales. 

Aba intends to reinvest the profits into her business for further expansion.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to increase her sales

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa A. makes her living by selling corn, a trade she has been in for four years, in Kokowada, Elmina. 
She is married to a farmer and they have five dependents. Her income pays for their children’s school fees and also contributes to some household expenses. It is important for her to grow her income and she plans to do so by expanding her business. A loan will allow her to purchase more corn and grow her sales. She intends to reinvest the profits back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: A loan will allow her to purchase more corn and grow her sales.

loans.name: Abena Badua Matilda

texts.en:
Abena Badua Matilda K. bakes and sells meat pies in Kokowada near Elmina. She has completed a junior high school education. She has been selling meat pies for six years. Married with two children, Abena’s income pays for her children’s school fees. It also helps her husband, a driver, pay for some household expenses. 

To improve her earnings, Abena wants to expand her business and requires a loan to do so. She intends to use the loan to purchase more ingredients so that she can bake more meat pies for sale. The extra profits she earns will be reinvested in her business for further growth.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to bake more meat pies for sale

loans.name: Monica Adjoa Mansah

texts.en:
For the past four years, Monica Adjoa Mansah T. has made a living by selling saucepans, pots and other cooking utensils in Kokowada, Elmina. Her income pays for her child’s school fees and also helps her husband, a farmer, pay for some household expenses. 

She aspires to grow her business and requires a loan to purchase more products for sale. Monica intends to use the profits from her expanded business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more products for sale

loans.name: Teresa Luz

texts.es: Teresa Luz tiene 66 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Por lo que no es la primera  vez que realiza financiamientos.  Teresa es madre soltera y lucha por mantener a sus 2 hijos. Tiene más de 14 años que tiene este medio de vida, ella siempre ha trabajo por el bienestar de su familia  a pesar de que su negocio es humilde tiene una gran variedad de clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos.  El crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos.
texts.en: 66-year old Teresa Luz runs a corner store. This is not the first time she has taken out a loan. She is a single mother and struggles to support her two children. She’s had this job for 14 years and has always worked hard for the wellbeing of her family. Although her business isn’t fancy, she has a wide range of customers who ask for different products. The loan will be used to buy candy, soft drinks, bread, detergent, and grains.

loans.use: to buy more stock

loans.name: Francisca Orvelina

texts.es: Francisca Orvelina tiene 46 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de molino. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este medio de vida. Ella dio inicio a esta actividad por esfuerzos propios, fue así logro conseguir con mucho esfuerzo una cierta cantidad de dinero para la compra poco a poco la maquinaria. Posteriormente compra el molino y obtuvo algo de ganancias, por lo que le gusto mucho trabajar en este tipo de negocio ya que por medio de esto logro proporcionarle la manutención necesaria a ella y sus hijos. Ahora está solicitando este financiamiento para comprar repuestos y proporcionarle mantenimiento al molino.
texts.en:
Francisca Orvelina is 46 years old.  Her business is providing milling services.  She has been in this line of work for more than 14 years and started the business through her own effort.

With a lot of hard work, Francisca managed to put together a certain quantity of money that she used to gradually buy machinery.  She bought her mill and made some profits.  She really enjoys working in this type of business as it allows her to support herself and her children.  She is requesting this loan to buy spare parts and to have maintenance work done on her mill.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.es: María Delfina tiene 47 años, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, comenzó a trabajar  desde muy joven inicio este medio de vida, pues tenía que mantener a sus 5 hijos actualmente solo 3 están a su cargo. Ella siempre ha sido una persona muy luchadora y disfruta de su negocio pues la mayoría de sus clientes siempre están solicitándole diferentes productos. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de  pinturas de uñas, talcos, cremas, sabanas y calzado. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: María Delfina is 47 years old and her business is selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years.  She started working when she was very young as she had to support her five children.  Currently only three of her children are still in her care.  María has always been a very hard-working person and she enjoys her work.  Her customers request different products from her.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy nail polish, talcum powder, creams, sheets and shoes.  Her wish is to get ahead in her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gioconda Del Carmen

texts.es: Gioconda tiene 33 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella tiene más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio, además de esto ella también tiene una pequeña pulpería ya que busca la forma de obtener ingresos para su hijo que son lo más importante. Ella se levanta muy temprano pues tiene que tomar diferentes autobuses para ofrecer sus productos, por que los distribuye de manera ambulante. Su deseo es mejorar su nivel de vida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de sabanas, manteles, ropa, calzado y cosméticos.
texts.en:
Gioconda is 33 years old.  Her business is selling general merchandise.  She has been in this business for more than 9 years.  She also runs a small grocery store since she needs to make money for her child which is the most important thing for her.

Gioconda gets up very early as she has to catch different buses in order to sell her products because she makes her sales in an itinerant manner.  Her wish is to improve her standard of living.  She will use her loan to buy sheets, tablecloths, clothes, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: Alberto José está casado y tiene 2 hijos que asisten a un colegio público, ya que no tiene los suficientes ingresos para mantenerlos en un privado. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, que está ubicada en su vivienda. Actualmente el se encuentra muy bien establecido en su vivienda, aunque no fue fácil enfrentar todas las dificultades por lo la que tuvo que atravesar. Ahora está solicitando un financiamiento que será utilizado para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, jugos, pan, dulces, huevos y gaseosas. Tiene el sueño de incrementar su negocio para que el día de mañana esto les asegure el futuro a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en: Alberto José is married and has two children that go to a public school, as he doesn’t have earn enough to keep them in a private school.  He has a local store located within his house.  He is currently well established in his house, although it was not easy to get through the difficulties he came across.  Now he is requesting a loan that will be used for working capital to buy basic grains, juices, bread, sweets, eggs, and sodas.  His dream is to expand his business so that he can ensure his two children’s future for tomorrow.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina es una mujer muy alegre y a demás responsable ella tiene dos hijos y están a su cargo. Hace 5 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de procesamiento de maíz, dicha actividad la realiza de una manera permanente porque cuando comenzó a trabajar fue por razón que como madre comprometida y responsable decidió ayuda a los ingresos de la familia ya que tenía que sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que por las mañanas realizaba la lo quehaceres del hogar y por las tardes sale a vender sus diferentes productos. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para brindar el mantenimiento de la maquina que utiliza. Su deseo es seguir esforzándose para que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada día
texts.en:
Reina is a cheerful woman who is responsible for her two dependent children. She has managed a business that provides corn processing services for more than five years. Being a committed and responsible mother, Reina decided to pursue this business full-time because she wanted to help with the family income and help her child succeed. Every morning she completes her household chores and then sells her various products in the afternoon.

Reina is currently requesting a loan so that she can maintain the machine she uses for her business. Her wish is to continue striving forward so that her children are not lacking in their daily needs.

loans.use: Operating capital to maintain her equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy candy, soft drinks, cookies, detergents, noodles, soap, matches, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital to buy tires, parts, tools, and other items

loans.name: Berthalina

texts.es: Berthalina tiene 49 años por lo que es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, Es una mujer muy responsable ya que tiene 6 hijos pero solamente 3 hijos están a su cargo y los mantiene ella ya que es madre soltera. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, por lo que más de 8 años que se dedica a este negocio a pesar de las dificultades que enfrento como es el poco apoyo que tenia por lo que no tenía el capital suficiente para invertir en todos los productos. Ahora solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, café, jugos, pan, galletas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Berthalina is 49 years old and this is the first time she has received financing. She is a very responsible woman who has six children, but only three of them are dependents. Berthalina takes care of them as a single mother. For more than eight years, she has managed a store despite the difficulties she has faced. Berthalina has little support and does not have sufficient capital to invest in all of her products.

Now she is requesting this loan to use as operating capital to buy candy, coffee, juices, bread, cookies, and sodas.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy candy, coffee, juices, bread, cookies, and sodas

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco José tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene 2 hijos a su cargo.  El señor brinda el servicio de taxi, este negocio lo inicia hace 7 años, cuando decidió iniciar con los financiamientos que le han sido de mucha ayuda ya que fue así cuando inicio su negocio. Cabe señalar, que con los ingresos que le ha dejado su negocio ha logrado mejorar los ingresos a su familia Francisco es un hombre que todos los días lleva una botella de agua para poder aguantar todo el día ya que tiene que pasar sentado recorriendo muchos lugares. El crédito será invertido para proporcionar mejoras a su vehículo. El sueño con respecto al negocio es que este crezca y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco José is 38 years old, married, and currently has two dependent children. He provides taxi services. Francisco started this business seven years ago. He decided to start his business with loans, which have been a great help. It should be mentioned that any profits remaining from his business have helped improve the family income. Every day Francisco takes a bottle of water with him because he has to spend time sitting as he travels to many places.

The loan will be used to make repairs to his vehicle. His dreams include growing in his business and improving his living conditions.

loans.use: Operating capital for vehicle repairs

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria del Carmen tiene 59 años su actividad es la compra y venta de huevos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 15 años, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio.  Sus inicios fueron con muy poco capital pero con el paso del tiempo puedo ir incrementando su inversión y realizando así este negocio mucho mas rentable.  Sin embargo, la señora se ayuda con la venta de gallinas, ya que obtiene un buen precio. Este financiamiento es para la compra de huevos y gallinas que es lo que sus clientes más demandan.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen is 59 years old and has a business buying and selling eggs. She started this business fifteen years ago and this is not the first time she has received financing for her business. Maria started this business with very little capital and as time passed, she was able to increase her investment and make her business more profitable. In addition, Sra. Maria del Carmen sells hens to help generate income since she can obtain them at a good price.

This loan will be used to buy eggs and hens since these products are in great demand among her customers.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy eggs & hens

loans.name: G.s. "san Nicolas" Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario “San Nicolas” está conformado por Ismael Antonio, Blanca Nubia y Sonia Del Carmen. Ellos son personas muy luchadoras y trabajadoras que disfrutan de su medio de vida. Ismael se dedica a una pulpería, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante, el se ha caracterizado por brindarles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. Sonia en cambio se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos, desde hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este medio de vida ya que ha sido una persona que le gusta el trabajo ella tiene a dos hijos menores a su cargo. Juntos se han unido para realizar el financiamiento de materia prima para sus negocios.
texts.en: The name of this group is "San Nicolas" and the members are Ismael Antonio, Blanca Nubia, and Sonya Del Carmen. They are very persistent and hard working people who enjoy their way of life. Ismael has a convenience store that he has made a success with a great deal of effort. He is known to provide his clients with whatever they request. Sonia has a livestock business, buying and selling swine. For the past 10 she has dedicated herself to this business and she has always been someone who enjoys work.  She has two young children in her care. They have come together to access a loan to purchase merchandise for their businesses.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marlene Sabina

texts.es: Marlene Sabina se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y también el destace de carne. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio, pues ha sido una mujer luchadora y disfruta de realizar esta actividad diariamente. Inicio este medio de vida por su familia, ella tiene un gran carisma para hablar con sus clientes que se encuentran satisfechos con los productos que brinda. Este negocio lo inicio para la compra de vacas y terneros ya que actualmente tiene gran demanda de parte de sus clientes.
texts.en: Marlene Sabina works buying and selling cattle, as well as butchering meat and she has had this business for more than six years.  She has been a determined woman and enjoys working in this business on a daily basis.  She started with this job because of her family.  Marlene is very charismatic in talking with her customers, who are very pleased with the products she provides.  She started this business buying cows and calves, as she currently has a large demand from her customers.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Freddy Jose

texts.es: El señor Freddy Jose, desde hace mas de siete años instalo en su casa de habitación una pulpería, que es atendía personalmente por él y su esposa, este negocio lo instalo como una fuente de empleo y de ingresos para la familia. Tiene un horario de atención de lunes a viernes de 6 de la mañana a 9 de la noche, vende granos básicos, refrescos naturales y artificiales, cosméticos, golosinas, ropa para niños y otros productos. Con este financiamiento aumentara el inventario de sus productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y de esa manera aumentar sus ganancias. El sueña con lograr convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en: More than seven years ago, Freddy Jose set up a local store in his house which he and his wife attend to personally.  He started the business to have a form of employment and income for the family.  His store is open for business from Monday to Friday, 6am to 9pm.  He sells basic grains, natural and artificially flavored refreshments, cosmetics, snacks, children’s clothing, and other items.  With this loan, he will increase his inventory of products to sell to his customers and thus, increase his earnings.  His dream is to be able to turn his local store into a distributor.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin se dedica a la venta y elaboración de muebles. Tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues los financiamientos le han sido de gran ayuda.  Tiene más de 13 años con esta actividad, el se siente muy orgulloso de poder sacar adelante a su hijo que está a su cargo. Todos los encargos que le realizan sus clientes son muy complicados, pues él se esmera en la buena atención con la elaboración. Este crédito es para la compra de madera, pega, clavos, maque, barniz entre otros.
texts.en: Edwin makes and sells furniture. He has been with Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for along time and the loans have been a great source of help. He has more than 13 years in his business and he is very proud to be able to provide for his son who is still in his care. All of the orders that are placed by his clients are very complicated but he endeavors to pay special attention to the finishing.  This loan will be used to purchase wood, glue, nails, lacquer, varnish, and other products.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry supplies.

loans.name: Janet Nicolasa

texts.es: Janet Nicolasa tiene 45 años, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, ella es una joven emprendedora le ha gustado trabajar para mantener a su familia. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son para el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Solicita este crédito para la compra de pantalones, ropa interior, camisetas, faldas, camisolas y trajes. Su mayor anhelo es ver a su familia progresar y mejorar gradualmente su calidad de vida. Para ello se ha propuesto trabajar arduamente y seguir adelante.
texts.en: Janet Nicolasa is 45 years old. Her business is the buying and selling of clothes. She has had her business more than 20 years. She is a young enterprising woman that loves to work and to support her family. The income that she earns from her business is destined for the family's finances. She requests a loan to purchase pants, interior clothing, t-shirts, skirts, and suits. Her greatest goal is to see her family progress and to gradually improve their quality of life. For this reason she has set out to work arduously and to pull through.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esperanza Estela

texts.es: Doña Esperanza Estela tiene su negocio que es la venta y elaboración de dulces.  Tiene más de 41 años en este negocio, por lo que no es el primer financiamiento que realiza, ya que le han sido de gran ayuda. Inicio este medio de vida, por su propio esfuerzo, ha sido admirable que ha mantenido este negocio a su edad, a pesar de todas las dificultades que enfrenta con los precios de los productos más caros. Esto no la desanima ya que solicita ayuda por medio de un financiamiento y poder comprar materia prima azúcar, coco, bolsas, colorantes entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Doña Esperanza Estela has a business preparing and selling sweets. She has more than 41 years of experience in this business. This is not the first time she has received financing and the loans have been a great help. Esperanza started as a result of her own effort, so it is admirable that she has been able to maintain her business at her age. Despite all the difficulties she has faced, including the cost of supplies becoming more expensive, she is not discouraged.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as sugar, cocoa, bags, food coloring, and other items.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy sugar, cocoa, bags, food coloring, and other items

loans.name: Fanis Esperanza

texts.es: Fanis Esperanza tiene 57 años, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de comida. Hace más de 18 años que inicio este negocio, a pesar de no tener mucho conocimiento es una persona que ha sabido salir adelante. La mayoría de los vecinos de Doña Fanis saben muy bien que ella cocina muy bien y que sus platillos son muy deliciosos, pues ella sabe que lo que más vende son las enchiladas y sus platanitos que pueden ser acompañados con cualquier comida. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y mejorar su producción. Su deseo es seguir obteniendo más fama con sus famosos platillos.
texts.en:
Fanis Esperanza is 57 years old and manages a business preparing and selling food. She has been in this business for more than eighteen years. Despite having very little education, she is a person who has managed to get ahead. Most of her neighbors know that she cooks very well and that her dishes are extremely delicious. Doña Faris is well-known for her enchiladas and the plantains that are served with every dish.

She is requesting this loan to use as operating capital so that she can improve her production. Her wish to continue gaining recognition for her famous dishes.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es: Alma Nidia tiene su negocio que es una farmacia, pues no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos para su negocio. Ella es una persona muy responsable lo ha demostrado por el buen record crediticio que tiene. Inicio este negocio por cuenta propia, ya que la mayoría de sus vecinos le solicitan diferentes medicamentos, ella siempre esta complaciéndoles y brindándoles un muy buena atención.  El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de una gran variedad de medicamentos, pues Alma los ofrece a aprecios accesibles.
texts.en:
Alma Nidia manages a pharmacy. This is not the first time she has requested a loan for her business. She is a person who has demonstrated that she is responsible through her good credit record. Alma started this business on her own since most of her neighbors are in need of different medicines. She is always friendly to them and provides them with good service.

The reason for this loan is to purchase a wide variety of medicines so that Alma can offer them at affordable prices.

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase medicines

loans.name: Triunfadores Group

texts.es: El señor Pablo José el señor es casado, su esposa trabaja como tortillera elaborando el producto desde su casa de habitación, tienen 4 hijos, dos de los cuales se encuentran estudiando en secundaria. El señor se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos de engorde. El obstáculo principal que ha vencido en su producción ha sido la falta de financiamiento que gracias a Fundación León 2000 pudo vencerla. Desea en un futuro construir dos galeras mas para producir más pollos, esto lo hará con ayuda de financiamiento. Don Félix Pedro tiene 62 años, es casado y tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad. Su esposa trabaja ayudándole a él en la panadería. Su negocio es la elaboración de pan, la cual ha tenido muy buena producción y las ventas se han incrementado considerablemente. En su negocio tiene bastante competencia y lo que hace es mejorar cada día la calidad del producto, ya que la gente se fija más en la calidad del producto que en el precio del mismo. Es por eso que juntos se han unido para realizar financiamientos a sus negocios.
texts.en:
Sr. Pablo José is married. His wife works as a tortilla maker and produces her product from home. They have four children, two of whom are high school students. Sr. Pablo José raises and sells fattened chickens. The main obstacle in his production has been overcome now that he has received funding from Fundación León 2000. In the future, he wants to build two more coops so that he can produce more chickens as a result of this assistance.

Don Félix Pedro is 62 years old, married, and has four grown children. His wife works with him at a bakery. He makes bread and has experienced a considerable increase in sales as a result of good production. His business faces plenty of competition, so he must improve the quality of his product each day. Customers pay more attention to product quality than price.

These two gentlemen have joined together to access financing for their businesses.

loans.use: Operating capital to build two chicken coops
